results.description: Come dance with us for our first "almost fall" event to introduce you to Modern Western Square Dancing.  You will learn lots of the basic steps right off, and have an amazing evening of fun with us.  Should you want more of a challenge, and to learn the steps leading to Mainstream level, you can begin classes in early October.  Either way, Times Squares promises you a party with lots of dancing and lots of laughs.
results.name: Dance Party

results.description:
Come see the highly acclaimed musical comedy "The Jackie Mason Musical" (Now in it's 5th year!) and attend a meet-and-greet with the entire cast afterwards! Including the producer, director, writer, and composer! The Meet-and-Greet is held at Alphies which is just down the block from the theater on 53rd and 9th! This is a wonderful networking opportunity, and a perfect place to make new friends in the theater community. Feel free to ask the cast and crew any questions about their long-running Off-Broadway experience. Normally this show is $59.00 but if you mention the meet-up, you can get tix for less than half price! $25 for meet-up members!

What the show is about:

Regarded by some as one of the greatest comics of all time, everyone knows the name Jackie Mason. But have you heard the one about the belly dancer? For the first time, The Jackie Mason Musical lifts the lid on the true story of Mason and his decade long love affair with the young Ginger Reiter, and the child they shared, Sheba Mason. Written, composed and directed by Ginger and starring Sheba as herself and her mom, this peek into the strange double life of an American icon is a hit for fans, old and new.

It all began in Miami in 1977. When their eyes meet in a deli, Jackie and Ginger have no idea of the complicated and long-running love story ahead of them. Urged by her glamorous mother Mrs Oliver, Ginger falls completely in love and is happy to be wooed by Jackie whenever he finds his way to South Florida. Unbeknownst to Ginger, Jackie seems to have alot of young lady freinds all over the country and when she becomes pregnant, she's left to bring up young Sheba alone in the midst of heartbreak.

Hilarious and original and packed with unique songs such as "Just An Ordinary Man," "I Never Met This Yenta" and more, this critically acclaimed Off Broadway musical is an absolute gem!

Ian Wehrle as Jackie Mason and a cast of 8.

TheJackieMasonMusical.com

ShebaMason.com
results.name: Meet-and-Greet with entire cast of The Jackie Mason Musical following the show!

results.description:
Join a bunch of Jewish singles from multiple meetup groups in the 21 to 49 age range as we casually stroll along the entire length of the High Line while the sun sets. This is a very popular event and you will meet a lot of people! 

What's the High Line you ask? The High Line is an elevated rail line transformed into a public park that spans 24 blocks on Manhattan’s West Side. From start to finish, the High Line walk is about a mile and takes roughly 30 minutes. 

Afterwards if you are inclined, we'll have a few drinks and chit chat on the Frying Pan. The Frying Pan is a salvaged historic boat turned into a giant floating restaurant and bar. It's always a huge hit. Everyone loves the Frying Pan! 

We'll meet at 7:30 PM on the corner of Ganesvoort and Washington streets under the start of the High Line and we'll get to know each other while we wait for everyone to arrive. 

The walk will start at EXACTLY 8 PM.  If you are late, you will miss us. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing under the start of the High Line and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host, Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Closest Subway: A, C, E and L 

Pace: The pace of this walk will be super casual.

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 


Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Jewish Singles Sunset Walk on the High Line | Age 21 to 49

group.name: Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network at over 15 of their partner social and singles groups. The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually  attending.  If you have any questions, please contact the event organizer at [masked].

This event features the best elements of a Match Live Event, Speed Dating and an Ice Breaker Night.  Join over 150 fun and friendly singles for a casual and comfortable singles party that you won't want to miss. The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel has a cozy atmosphere that is casual, comfortable and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene.  We will have games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a fun, friendly and flirty way.

Here is how it works..

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches.

-We will have several ice breaker games throughout the night where you will have a chance to meet others at the event and write down the code names and numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

-At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

-Drink specials till 9pm

-3 separate Ice Breaker games with prizes

-A delicious menu is available

-Music played at conversational levels.  Music is all in the background.  There will be no dancing (unless you want to!)


Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  You may also bring a non single wing person who will be identified by pairs of wings.

What are the age ranges? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.

Dress code: No need for jackets or cocktail dresses but Keep it neat.

Admission: $15 prepay $20 at the door.

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$


USE THIS LINK TO PRE PAY https://www.eventbrite.com/e/singles-mix-match-mingle-party-tickets-18212827056

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
results.name: Singles Mix, Match & Mingle Singles Party: NYC"s Most Fun, Casual & Comfortable

It was a good turnout last week, and very nice to meet so many cool Texans fans...

For preseason week 2, Double Wide continues as your temporary Texans home until 25 Avenue B reopens as Avenida Cantina, NYC's newest Tex Mex spot!

During the game, you'll enjoy:

- $5 Queso

- $4 Shiner and Lone Star

-$6 Tito's

Avenida is slated to open in mid-September, so we'll keep this group in the loop on all events.  Hope to see you at Double Wide until then...

-Upon arrive you will be given a name tag with your code name and number..

-You will also be given a sheet where you can keep track of everyone you meet.

results.description:
Join 100+ singles for this unique singles party! It's a fun, new way to connect! This will be one of the friendliest and most social singles events you will experience! 

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.  

PREPAY ONLY ($10, goes up to $15 as date gets closer) 

GET TICKETS HERE -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Aug-22-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works: 

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches. 

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature: 

• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available 

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door).  Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Aug-22-2015_at_0800PM

What is the Lexington Lounge like? It is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the stylish Cort Hotel on 39th & Lex that features a 25 ft bar, a pool table plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas.  

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.  

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event.  This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Aug-22-2015_at_0800PM

results.description:
Join 100+ singles for this unique singles party! It's a fun, new way to connect! This will be one of the friendliest and most social singles events you will experience!

The atmosphere is casual and relaxed so you can interact with others at the party without being distracted by the usual singles bar scene. We'll have different games and activities designed for you to meet dozens of people there in a friendly & flirty way.

PREPAY ONLY ($10, goes up to $15 as date gets closer)

GET TICKETS HERE -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Aug-22-2015_at_0800PM

Here is how it works:

• Upon arrival you'll receive a name tag with your code name and a sheet to keep track of everyone you meet for matches.

• We'll have several ice breaker games during the night where you'll get to meet others and write down the code names & numbers of those you wish to make a connection with.

• At the end of the night hand in your sheet and we will send you the contact info for all the people who have a mutual match with you! You will be able to choose up to 10 people for potential matches.

The Night Will Feature:

• Drink specials

• Ice Breaker Games

• Prizes & Giveaways

• Food menu available

• Music played at conversational levels

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No Tix Sold At Door).  Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Aug-22-2015_at_0800PM

What is the Lexington Lounge like? It is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the stylish Cort Hotel on 39th & Lex that features a 25 ft bar, a pool table plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas.

Can I come alone? Yes 90% of those attending will be coming solo. But you can also invite single friends to join you or bring a non-single wing person. Everyone must have a ticket to enter.

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event will cater mostly to 20's-40's.  It is not meant to be ethnic specific or completely gender balanced. There will be age specific matching games but you will also have a chance to match outside of your age range.

Is there a dress code? No specific dress code. We just suggest "neat casual".

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 100+ members attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/mixmatch/dates/Aug-22-2015_at_0800PM

results.description:
CLOSING NIGHT! Rooftop concludes our 19th year with stunning short films about saying goodbye.

All good things must come to an end. Teen friendships end in a dare, adult relationships dissolve in resignation, the love of a bumblebee and a monkey burns out in flames. You might jump off a cliff, disappear into the desert, or fight to the death, because endings bring out powerful emotions and evocative actions. So at Rooftop Films, we close out our year with a program of sweet, silly and somber stories of people saying, “So long.” . . . We’ll see you next year! 
‐MER

THE FILMS

KUKKA&HAUTA (Tomi Malkki | Finland | 4 min.)
If the bee disappeared off the surface of the globe, then man would have only four years of life left.

BLOBBY (Laura Stewart | USA)
A man is followed around by a blob as he goes about his daily life.

SLEEPERS' BEAT (Anastasia Kirillova | UK | 16 min.)
In this cinematic ode to the Trans-Siberian railway, the train staff seem unable to live without the hypnotic beats and rattle of the train.

WE WILL STAY IN TOUCH ABOUT IT (Jan Zabeil | Germany | 8 min.)
A man drives through a deserted landscape. Suddenly his car hits a person, seriously hurting or even killing him. The driver searches for the body, cannot find it - and must accept that there is no one. Instead, he does find blood on the broken windshield. What happens when realizing that we kill - without being confronted with the dead?

BLOEDHOND (Mees Peijnenburg | Netherlands | 8 min.)
Gijs’ aggression is becoming more and more of a problem. If he doesn’t take action now his explosive temper will cause irreversible damage.

LAST BASE (Aslak Danbolt | Norway | 15 min.)
Joachim is retiring from base-jumping to become a father for the first time, but first he goes on one last adventure with his best-friend Øyvind. When a storm approaches their friendship is put to the test; Øyvind wants to turn back, but Joachim will apparently stop at nothing to pull off his very last jump.

LE MAL DU CITRON (Jeremy Rosenstein and Kaspar Schiltknecht | Switzerland | 19 min.)
Florence and Etienne, a couple in their 30’s, travel to the South of France to visit Florence’s dead father’s house. Florence’s father has hung himself from a tree. Having not spoken to her father in many years, his death apparently doesn’t affect Florence. How is she gonna mourn someone she was not caring about? Etienne will soon discover that what seems to be indifferent to Florence is not. It is then that the couple’s excursion brings up the challenge to open up to each other about unspoken truths.

SLEEPING GIANT (Andrew Cividino | Canada | 17 min.)
Fourteen-year-old Adam is spending the summer in a small beach community on the North shore of Lake Superior. His dull summer routine shatters when he meets local boys Foster and Rizzo, two smart alecks who fill their long days with adventures and reckless stunting. When Adam learns he is competing with Foster for the affection of his crush, Taylor, he is drawn into a dark and unfamiliar world which leads the boys to the top of the infamous Todd's Cliff.

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.

results.description:
Though it was the last of Roger Corman's eight films based on Edgar Allen Poe stories, The Tomb of Ligeia remains one of the finest in the bunch easily standing in the same territory as The Fall of the House of Usher and Masque of the Red Death. The final result has the feel of a scary supernatural take on Hitchcock's Rebecca. Tomb succeeds on a variety of levels including Robert Towne's excellent script, the use of widescreen photography, fantastic sets and locations that add to the scary atmosphere, and a great performance by Vincent Price. Here, Price plays a brooding widower (with a curious eye malady) whose obsession with his late wife takes a terrifying turn for the worse once he takes a new wife. Elizabeth Shepherd is also good as the frightened, but curious, bride who finds herself stalked by one of the nastiest cats in cinema history. In one excellent sequence, the evil black feline lures Shepherd deep into the maze-like catacombs of their abbey home while Price's voice-over reveals details about his late wife, Ligeia. The camera work by Arthur Grant is top-notch with outdoor lensing bright, but suitably grey and gloomy. Dark interior photography adds to the chilling atmosphere.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MZBBhIsfRMU

results.description:
Hey Everyone! I've secured a limited number of complimentary tickets to After Hours Comedy at Gotham Comedy Club for a great night of standup on Saturday, August 22 at 10:45pm!

THESE COMP TICKETS ARE AVAILABLE TO EVERYONE IN THE GROUP! Gotham is one of the BEST and CLASSIEST clubs in NYC.

Tickets are normally priced at $15 each! If anyone wants to go, just make sure to RSVP through the online link below to get your tickets. Link will be active until 11:59pm Thursday, August 20. After that we may be able to get some discount tickets.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-sat-aug-22-1045pm-tickets-18110649440

The show is called "After Hours: Comedy" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, HBO, MTV, Late Night TV, and more! Keep your weekend fun flowing and unwind from a long week at work.

The show starts at 10:45pm but they request you all arrive inside the club by 10:15pm to get your seats. There is a large table on one side of the room that we will reserve depending upon how many RSVPs we get. We usually have people start arrive around 10 so you can grab a drink and mingle and make friends before the show starts.

Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)

Can't wait to see you all at the show!
results.name: Free Admission! After Hours Comedy at Gotham Comedy Club

results.description:
Bring your cameras and laptops and join the two Davids (D.A.Wagner & David Mark Erickson) as we walk across the Manhattan bridge to Brooklyn and capture unobstructed spectacular panoramic views in the early morning light of the Brooklyn Bridge and NYC Skyline. We'll also have the beautiful details of the Manhattan Bridge and fabulous walls full of graffiti as we walk far above Chinatown! 

We'll end the walk just below the Brooklyn Bridge for some more spectacular views. 


After a short break for coffee/breakfast, we will have a Lightroom post production session (at a near by office conference room in Dumbo) where Certified Lightroom Experts D.A. and David will be available to help you stitch panoramas and answer your editing and developing questions.


Yes, we know 7AM is early, but that's when the light's best and the tourists are nowhere in sight. And you can't beat the price: FREE! Compliments of your NYC Lightroom Meetup Group hosts.


We will be meeting at the Pedestrian Walk Entrance on the Manhattan Side of the Manhattan Bridge. Our meeting location is right on the map, where it says "1BY Collision." 

If you haven't already, make sure to upgrade to Lightroom 6/Lightroom CC beforehand so you can use some of the new features. You can also download a free 30 day trial of Lightroom CC here.

The Walkabout group limited to 20, so sign up before it fills up!

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans,

After a four week summer break, the teams (and fans) are ready to resume the Formula 1 season. Round eleven takes us to the legendary Spa-Francorchamps circuit, one of the F1 calendar’s true classics and one of its toughest tests.

THE TRACK - At 4.35 miles in length, it is the longest on the F1 calendar with iconic corners such as Eau Rouge that tests cars and drivers to the limit. Spa-Francorchamps is one of the season’s fastest tracks with average speeds of 230km/h and the stretch from the exit of La Source to Les Combes sees the throttle wide open for the longest single period on the calendar. Finding the right balance between low down force for the high-speed first & third sectors and good grip for the twistier middle sector will pose a tricky challenge with the set-up for the teams.

STANDINGS - Lewis Hamilton leads the Driver's Championship with 202 points followed by his teammate Nico Rosberg with 181 points. Sebastian Vettel has closed the gap to the Mercedes drivers after the win in Hungary. Vettel trails Rosberg by 21 points. In the Constructor's Championship, Mercedes still holds a commanding lead of 383 points with Ferrari in 2nd with 236 points and Williams in 3rd with 151 points.

TYRE ALLOCATION - As in Hungary, Pirelli will be bringing the P Zero White medium and Yellow soft tires. Pirelli expects a performance gap of 1.8 – 2.0  seconds per lap between the two compounds.

TALKING POINTS - Will the new start rules result in changes to the competitive order on the opening laps of race? Can Hamilton bounce from a disastrous race in Hungary with a win at Spa? Will this be the race where Raikkonen win the first race of the season? Can Rosberg take the chequered flag in Spa and reduce the gap in Drives Championship? If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Belgian Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. 

Race will start at 08:00 AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 07:30 AM EDT. It's going to be another fantastic race.


We hope to see you all!
results.name: 2015 Belgian Grand Prix

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.name: 3D TROPHY SHOOT

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. results.description:
Hello! This is a Trip NOT to be Missed. 

1st We will Tour the 911 Memorials Museum and NOT wait in the Long Long line W Priority Access. 


https://www.911memorial.org/visit
Entering the museum, it’s immediately apparent how much effort and care went into it; the entire site is constructed to the highest order.
The museum is a homage to the Twin Towers themselves and their history, as well as to the events of 9/11 and its aftermath.

Its location is actually underground, beneath the plaza of the memorial—in fact, the walls of the fountains can be seen from inside the museum and there are exhibits to be seen underneath both fountains, which occupy the exact locations of each original tower.

2nd   We will journey across to the the Brookfield Plaza, Lunch will be here on your own @ the

a http://brookfieldplaceny.com/directory/food


Located in Lower Manhattan's Battery Park City, a Fabulous and I do NYC Fabulous Its a great place for Shopping w  selection of World Class Eateries right on the Hudson! Perfect for Lunch  

After Lunch 

3rd Irish Hunger Memorial

http://bpcparks.org/whats-here/parks/irish-hunger-memorial/


The Memorial represents a rural Irish landscape with an abandoned stone cottage, stone walls, fallow potato fields and the flora on the north Connacht wetlands. It is both a metaphor for the Great Irish Famine and a reminder that hunger today is often the result of lack of access to land. The 96’ x 170’ Memorial, designed by artist Brian Tolle, contains stones from each of Ireland’s 32 counties, and is elevated on a limestone plinth. Along the base are bands of texts separated by layers of imported Kilkenny limestone.


4th We will Tour long-awaited Freedom Tower observatory https://oneworldobservatory.com/


Housed on floors 100, 101 and 102 of the nation’s tallest skyscraper, the One World Observatory will provide panoramic views and an “unparalleled opportunity to experience New York City,

We have Priority tickets Purchased in advance allows Us to visit the 9/11 Memorial Museum at Our preferred date and Time. 


Please wear Comfortable shoes there is Plenty of walking !

http://www.history.com/topics/911-rebuilding-of-ground-zero


This Trip includes: 

1.-RT Transposition on a  Luxury Bus {w  Tolls and Tips}   and ALL Parking fees.

2. The 9 11 Memorial Museum fees


3. Freedom Tower observatory Fees

4.  Delicious  Buffet Dinner @ Rivara's w all Taxes And Tips

      For Only $129.00pp

 (When I previewed the Museum's -Parking was $40.00+Tolls $14.00 +$15.00 Gas=$ 69.00 Just to get there and parking was 1/4 mile away)


Please PLease SEND Payments ASAP - PLEASE 


This Trip will Sell out- Its a Great Deal! 

When you RSVP -Payments MUST be made PLEASE 

To Robert Gilligan, PO BOX, 184, Ridgewood,NJ 07451


or 

With Credit Cards  to PAYPAL.com


My PAYPAL.COM  Address is " [masked] "

Please send money "As owed to a friend" to save fees.

Thanks for your Cooperation,

Questions? [masked] 


Robert

RSVP "Etiquette" for Gilligan's Adventures Meet-up Group.

1.  No Show/ Payment policy -If you RSVP "Yes" to an event, Please honor that YES rsvp.  Remember if you RSVP for a event, then not show, and not change your RSVP and not pay, you’re just being rude, and you’re costing time and money, 

Plus You’ve probably preventing and keeping a lovely soul from joining us.

If you RSVP to a this event, and do not pay and or not acknowledge emails. 

You will be on double secret probation-

After that....

You are Out! Finished, Done!

https://youtu.be/UKMuVFz3MOQ 

 I'm just asking for you cooperation, 


Thank you! Robert

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.name: SCUBA Lessons at the Pool

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

venue.address_1: Atlantic terminal is across the street from the Williamsburg Savings Bank
venue.name: Brooklyn, Atlantic terminal

results.description:
WHAT: Let's get together and discover more hidden jams of Long Island.
This time we'll explore Coindre Hall Park. It's a 33 acre park and 80,000 square foot mansion, with 40-room, in the style of a medieval French chateau, overlooking Huntington Harbor. Built for pharmaceutical giant George McKesson Brown in 1912, this mansion represents the height of the Gold Coast era with its Medieval turrets and sweeping views of the harbor.    
        Then we'll walk to Caumsett State Historic Park Preserve, situated on a scenic peninsula extending into Long Island Sound, In 1921 Marshall Field III purchased 1750 acres of Lloyd Neck and named the land after its Matinecock Indian name, Caumsett, which means "place by a sharp rock".  We'll hike thru beautiful gardens and nature trails over acres of woodland, meadows, rock shoreline and salt marsh.
Also we'll see the grounds of the Seminary of the Immaculate Conception with former Rosemary Cottage Estate.
We'll walk along picturesque Lloyd harbor road, we'll enjoy pristine and peaceful view of Oyster bay harbor and
we'll have a rare chance to see gorgeous Huntington lighthouse near-at-hand.
The pace of a hike is very moderate, there will be plenty of shades along the road and cool breeze from Oyster bay and Huntington harbors. The hike will take place in Long Island. It's about 6 miles between described above places, plus we'll walk inside of landmark estate and gardens. It's a combination of walking, hiking and sightseeing.
Meeting at 8:15 AM on Sunday, August 23 at Long Island Rail Road Atlantic Station tickets booth.
The Atlantic Avenue Terminal is located across the street from the Williamsburg Savings Bank, the tallest building in Brooklyn which has a large clock on each side of its tower. You can take B, Q trains to Atlantic station or N, 2, 3, 4, 5 trains to Pacific station and walk toward LIRR ticket booth. I'll be waiting for you right there.
CONTACT: My phone:[masked]
COST: $19 for LIRR round trip ticket. $6 for cab
TRANSPORT: We will take Long Island Rail Road to Huntington station. The departure of the train from Brooklyn (Atlantic terminal) at 8:22A.M, Manhattan (Penn station) at 8:25AM, and Queens (Jamaica station) at 8:52A.M. We’ll arrive to Huntington station at 9:30A.M. Please, wear the proper shoes and attire for a hike. (No high heels etc.) Please, bring water and bug repellent. Also, somewhere along the way, we'll have a picnic, so bring snacks or light picnic food.
results.name: Lloyd Harbor, Caumsett Estate, Coindre Hall, Huntington light house

Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
The High Line is a public park built on a historic freight rail line elevated above the streets on Manhattan’s West Side. It runs from Gansevoort Street in the Meatpacking District to West 34th Street, between 10th and 12th Avenues. There are many things and people to photograph on the 1.45 mile elevated park. The area around the High Line was once the booming meat, fruit and biscuit center of New York. The new park gives a unique view of the city and has created its own green spaces. Learn more at http://www.thehighline.org.

We’ll start at the 30th Street entrance between 10th and 11th Ave. and walk south. It is a short walk from NYC Penn Station. There won't be any formal program, we just all meetup and wander down the line.

At noon, those who would like to can meet for lunch, location to be determined. (Any suggestions are appreciated)

I’ll be catching the 7:21 a.m. Raritan Valley Line train from Somerville to NYC Penn Station, we can make it a photographer train!

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. Are you Looking to get fit? 
Need to drop a few pounds? 
Want to get in shape for the summer?

Try a FREE class at CrossFit Outbreak Boot Camp in Ft. Greene Park.

Our Boot Camp classes are designed to introduce you to CrossFit. We want to get you fit and healthy, challenge your mind and body - we love to MAKE FITNESS FUN.

The first class is free, each class after that is $15.00.

There is no obligation to join our gym outside of this class. The Exercises: CrossFit is a combination of strength, cardio, muscle endurance, flexibility, core, and functional movement patterns. You get EVERYTHING you need!

Time Efficient Training. Our classes are 60 minutes in length. 
We utilize the principle of muscle confusion. You will NEVER do the same workout twice! Why is this good? Because…your body will never adapt and you will keep on getting stronger and fitter.

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

results.description:
This Meetup is announced for 10am, but you can also come at 2pm.

Come riding on the beautiful trail system that spans Old Westbury-Brookville-Muttontown. All skill levels are welcome.  It's close and easy to get to from anywhere in the NYC Metro area, by car or by public transportation.

We ride in English tack, in small groups only.  Our horses are excellent: forgiving of beginners, but willing to show skilled riders a good time. If you have the skills, we'll walk-trot-canter, maybe even take a small jump.  Instruction is offered, as needed/desired.  We'll be in the saddle for at least 1 1/4 hours, probably closer to 1 3/4 hours; cost is $100 per person.  

Come discover one of the best riding opportunities in the NY Metro Area.  Don't be confined to the ring -- ride for miles through woods and fields!


We're riding every week.  If you want to come along, email me directly: [masked]

Janet

Your Meetup Organizer

If you are not on vacation this weekend, come take a 45 minute vacay in Prospect Park. It's going to be beautiful out. The first 10 minutes will be a little about meditation/getting comfortable, then 25-30 minutes of guided meditation using the breath, sound and mantra meditation and voila, the remainder for comments, questions and community.

We'll be at the green space east of the picnic house-- on the long meadow! https://www.prospectpark.org/visit-the-park/park-map/ LOOK FOR THE FADED RED BLANKET.

Remember to wear something comfortable and bring a chair, cushion and/or mat to sit on... bring anything really that will allow you to sit ease-fully for 45 minutes. $5 suggested donation. If you can't make it this Sunday, I hope to run others at other times/days!

Jess

Soccer Beyond and New York City Soccer Collective are organizing a one day soccer tournament in August with several of New York's top local teams coming out to participate. We invite you to join what's shaping up to be a great day of skill, competition and spirit! All details below. 

Details

1. Date: Sunday, August 23rd 

2. Time: <a>10 AM - 5 PM</a> (if you are fortunate to make it all the way to finals, most teams finish within 3 hours).

3. Locations: Randall's Island (fields 80-85).

4. Roster: 7 vs 7 games. Minimum 7 Players and Max of 11. Free agents will be placed in a team.  

5. Game Time: 30 Mins Per Game. 4 Guaranteed Games.

6.  Structure: Group Stage followed by playoffs.

7. Coed: Open. Tournament is co-ed but there are no minimums on each team. Your team can be all girls, all guys or any combination.

8. Level: Casual - Intermediate

results.description:
Come to hit... Stay for a set. Singles sets! Doubles sets! Triple sec!? Too early?

Weather: Check back for any cancellations due to poor weather or otherwise.

Transit: 6 train to last stop at Pelham Bay Park and short walk. BX5, BX12 and BX29 within walking distance.

• Court number/location will be announced in comments upon arrival.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
The South and North Country Trails are the longest continuous paved bike paths in the area and are free of any cars/traffic, and provide an amazing ride through nothing but woods the entire way. The south county trail begins in Van Cortland Park in the Bronx, and continue for 14.1 miles up to Elmsford NY, and the North County trail picks up from there and continues for another 36.2 miles (combination of North County and Putnam County trail) until Brewster NY.  


We will have three meeting locations that morning: 

• First is W 79th St Boat Basin along the Hudson River Greenway at 930 am for anyone coming from Manhattan or Brooklyn and wants to ride from there (this add ~10 miles, 45 mins to the day). 

• From there we will continue north on the greenway bike path to the second meet point at[masked] am, at the corner of Dyckman/Broadway, which is an easy location as the A train to Dyckman St is right there at that corner. There is a nice coffee shop (park view, much better than the starbucks next door) and bike shop at the corner of Dyckman/Broadway where we can grab a quick brew. 

•  Then we will cross the broadway bridge into the bronx to the main meeting/start point, at Van Cortland Park S/Broadway at 1030 am (you will see a big arch entrance). 

I will post comments on the meetup page at each stop point when I arrive there to give other riders an update on my location. Also you can use an app called Glympse to get my location sent to your phone, which you can use at any point during the day. I will not wait more than 10 minutes at each of the start points. If you are late, please post a comment or text me and then attempt to catch up. Familiarize yourself with the route before you come. 

The entire 50 miles takes about 4-6 hours, depending on pace and NOT counting the stop at the brewery. This trail is virtually flat the entire way, I believe the elevation loss/gain is ~400 feet. It is the most relaxing bike path I have done in the area, as it is nearly continuous with very few street crossings, few pedestrians, no cars, just you and a paved bike path through the woods! This will be a relaxing easy pace ride, not a race. There will be stops ~10-15 miles to take a break, grab a snack, etc. 


We will stop at the Captain Lawrence Brewery in Elmsford midway to "hydrate" and they have a wood fire pizza stand there for anyone wanting to have some lunch :) 

At the end in Brewster, we will ride ~1 mile to the Metro North station to take the train back to NYC. 

http://www.nycbikemaps.com/maps/north-and-south-county-trailways-bike-map/


There is a small one mile section of road that has not been completed to connect the South and North County trail near Elmsford, it is a mile long on route 9A. This is where we will go to the Brewery actually so it works out perfectly. 

Dont feel up for 50 miles? No worries, anyone can come along, you have several options. You can do just the South County trail up to the Brewery and then head back, which is ~15 miles each way, 30 miles total. That would be about 2-3 hours riding time depending on pace. One can also ride to several other towns along the trail and ride the Metro North back, from either Tarrytown (~20 miles riding) or Pleasantville (~25 miles) or Katonah (~40 miles). Or you can ride up to any point and turn back and head back to the start at Van Cortland Park. Familiarize yourself with the map to know where these bail out points are. 

What to bring: Must have own bike (road bike or hybrid/touring bike preferable). Water (either water bottles on bike, or hydration pack), will pass a few locations with water fountains to refill water. Snacks (bars, trail mix, anything quick to eat) and/or sandwich for more calories. Comfortable clothes to ride in, bike shorts are ideal for longer rides. If there is forecast for rain (>30%) I will cancel. 

Directions/Logistics: We will start at Van Cortland Park South, near Broadway, at intersection of Broadway and 242nd St/Van Cortland Park South,  meet at 1030 am at the park entrance.  See above for other start point options. For public transportation take the 1 train to 238 St stop, 2nd to last stop (NOT the Van Cortland park stop).  Other options are the A train to the last stop in Manhattan and ride up Bway across the Bway bridge to Van Cortland Park. The 4 train seems close but requires going down stairs to cut through to Van Cortland Park. You can also drive to Van Cortland Park (I-87 to Van Cortland Park exit) and park your car there, but its difficult to return to the car afterward from the Metro North. We will then ride the Metro North back from the end of the trail at Brewster to Grand Central Terminal (~1.5 hour train ride). Metro North requires a bike permit to bring bikes on board, which can be purchased IN ADVANCE at Grand Central Terminal for only $5 for lifetime (If you do not buy in advance, they will charge you $10 on the train to bring the bike on board, for ONLY that one ride). You can buy the train tickets at the Brewster stop however the trains run every :17 of the hour on Saturdays, so the goal would be to finish by 4 pm if possible, depending on pace and stops. 

Feel free to email or text me in case of any questions:

[masked]  

[masked]
results.name: Bike 50 miles from NYC to Brewster w/ stop at a Brewery for lunch

Celebrate with us at the Divine Light Awakening Center (Divya Jyoti Kendra) Special Once a Year Event! Join Us for Live Music and Festivities!
We invite you to attend GURU PURNIMA 2015 on Sunday, August 23rd.

WHAT IS GURU PURNIMA?

Guru Purnima is an ancient celebration that dates back centuries. It's a celebration that commemorates the bond between a master and disciple. The master is the one who, by opening the third eye, teaches the disciple the art of meditation and leads him on his personal path from darkness to light.

WHAT IS MEDITATION?

Meditation is a practice in which an individual trains the mind or induces a mode of consciousness. In meditation one is able to experience the self which leads to a peaceful and stress free life; ultimately achieving bliss and tranquility through a balanced mind and healthy lifestyle!

FREE ADMISSION AND LUNCH!

Refreshments: 9:30am-10:30am
Opening Ceremony: 10:30am-11:00am
Program: 11:00am-1:30pm
Lunch: 1:30-2:30pm

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Hey summer is here. Let's go to Skudin Surfing School at Long Beach to learn surfing.

For the longest time you've been promising yourself, "This is the year I'm going to learn how to surf!" Well here you are about to make that dream come true! Our Long Beach Surf School is located between Long Beach Blvd and Riverside Blvd in Long Beach, NY.  Our family has been teaching surfing in Long Beach since the 70′s with its perfect sand bars and conditions it’s our premier spot.  Long Beach, NY has one of the most beautiful beaches in the country with its brand new 2.5 mile boardwalk its a great trip to take and enjoy all that this community has to offer.  Only a 50 minute LIRR train ride from Penn Station and easy drive from New York City.  With its own parking lot its an easy walk to the beach and is perfect for bringing the family or coming solo to learn how to surf.

Date: August 23rd Sunday departs at 11:00 AM in midtown west Manhattan, and 11:45 AM in Flushing; Please arrive 15 minutes earlier than departing time. We will depart sharp on time. (Event Time: 1:30 PM- 3:00 PM)

Depart 11:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 11:45 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map).

Return: Depart from Long Beach  at 5:00 PM after a quick bite, and get back to Flushing at around 6:00 PM & Manhattan 7:00 PM.

Cost: Early Birds $79 (Save $21 off Retail Value $100 including transport) for first 8 spots or RSVPed 14 days in advance; Regular $89 afterward. Tickets without transport will be added later ($10 less than those with transport).

Additional Cost: Beach Pass $8; bring $8 cash & ask for Skudin School for the special price (Regular $12)

Purchase Ticket Here: http://aug2015surfinglb.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

Includes: 1.5 hours lesson, boards & wet suits (if necessary); fresh shower available. Luxury van transport from midtown Manhattan & Flushing.

What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, swim wear, towel, sandals, clothes to change, and attitude to learn.

Maximum: 15 (All 15 surf boards reserved for our group)

Additional Info: 3 to 1 student to instructor ratio (5 instructors)

Refund Policy:
* $10 processing fee if cancelled on or before 2 weeks prior to the event date;
* 50% refund if cancelled on or before 1 week prior to the event date;
* No refund for cancellation or no show afterward; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.

After lesson, we can have late lunch or drinks together.


DIRECTIONS

LIRR Long Beach Branch
Arrive at Long Beach Station, walk south toward the beach, turn right and walk 3 blocks to Long Beach Blvd Beach

GPS

Click the link to Skudin Surf School

results.description:
Members keep insisting that they want to do some serious Russian reading. One of the names most often cited as someone people want to read is Fyodor Dostoyevsky. Let's see if people are willing to cash that literary check by rounding out the lazy summer with a hefty 448 page Russian tome. 

The two years before he wrote Crime and Punishment had been bad ones for Dostoyevsky. His wife and brother had died; the magazine he and his brother had started collapsed under its load of debt; and he was threatened with debtor's prison. With an advance that he managed to wangle for an unwritten novel, he fled to Wiesbaden, hoping to win enough at the roulette table to get himself out of debt. Instead, he lost all his money; he had to pawn his clothes and beg friends for loans to pay his hotel bill and get back to Russia. One of his begging letters went to a magazine editor, asking for an advance on yet another unwritten novel — which he described as Crime and Punishment. One of the supreme masterpieces of world literature, Crime and Punishment catapulted Dostoyevsky to the forefront of Russian writers and into the ranks of the world's greatest novelists.

Crime and Punishment focuses on the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in St. Petersburg  who formulates and executes a plan to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker or her cash. Raskolnikov argues that with the pawnbroker's money he can perform good deeds to counterbalance the crime, while ridding the world of a worthless vermin. He also commits this murder to test his own hypothesis that some people are naturally capable of such things, and even have the right to do them. Several times throughout the novel, Raskolnikov justifies his actions by comparing himself with Napoleon Bonaparte, believing that murder is permissible in pursuit of a higher purpose.

It is often said that Crime and Punishment is a study of guilt, but this is not strictly accurate: Raskolnikov does not feel guilt, but he does feel terror and an extraordinary depth of alienation from the rest of humanity. The other characters in the novel, because they are seen through the distorted lens of Rodion's perception, are largely ciphers. Even though friends make their best efforts to help him, he is unable to accept their help. He is even unable to understand their feelings of love and sympathy. 

As readers we are plunged into one man's delirium, a symbol for the incomprehension which might overtake us all if we looked closely enough at our fellow human beings. The novel is full of half-conversations; we are never certain whether Rodion fully understands anything that is said to him, and certainly the other characters, because they are kept away from his secret, rarely understand anything he says to them. Although written in 1866, Crime and Punishment stands as the great antecedent to the 20th-century literature of alienation represented in figures such as Camus and Beckett.
