results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/Hugh%20Taft%20Morales.jpg?itok=ojOU_3g4 Hugh Taft Morales

Dr. Anne Klaeysen Presides 

Humanist Spirituality

A growing number of people today describe themselves as “spiritual but not religious.”  They yearn for something more than mundane experiences of every day life, but without the trappings of dogma and bureaucracy.  Hugh Taft-Morales explores ways humanists could best approach the word “spiritual?”  Is it a danger to reason because, as the founder of Ethical Culture, Felix Adler, said, it is often “a synonym of muddy thought and misty emotionalism?” Or can naturalistic forms of spirituality found in Spinoza, John Dewey, and Carl Sagan enliven humanism today?  How might humanist spirituality help us make progress on, to quote David Brooks, the “road to character?”

Born and raised in Connecticut, Hugh Taft-Morales graduated from Yale University in 1979 and earned a Masters in Philosophy from University of Kent at Canterbury.  He taught philosophy and history for twenty-five years in Washington, D. C., after which he transitioned into Ethical Culture Leadership. He served on the Board of the Washington Ethical Society from[masked], the last year as president. In April of 2009 he graduated from the Humanist Institute and was certified as an Ethical Culture Leader by the American Ethical Union (AEU) in 2010.

He currently is leader of the Ethical Humanist Society of Philadelphia and the Baltimore Ethical Society. He serves as Vice President of the National Leaders Council of the American Ethical Union and is editor of the AEU’s Ethical Action Report.

Hugh lives in Takoma Park, Maryland, with his wife, Maureen, a Latin American analyst for the Congressional Research Service.  They have three wonderful children – Sean (28), Maya (22), and Justin (19).  Hugh's hobbies include yoga, singing and playing guitar, and "watching way too much sports."

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

<a>
</a>

results.description:
Out of the Netherlands comes this new idea for organizing the communication and decision-making in organizations. Sociocracy is consent-based, allowing more participation and more distributed decision-making than in traditional organizational structures, especially those that are hierarchical. Sociocracy also adapt naturally to growth in size, with a structure that evolves to meet changing needs. It's currently being used in not-for-profit, community and even for-profit organizations. Learn a bit about it, and practice some of the skills that make this model work.
Jone Johnson Lewis has been our Interim Clergy Leader for two years, and has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991. She has a background in organizational development, religion and history.
results.name: Summer Workshop: Sociocracy: A New Way of Organizing

results.description:
Taiji Basics: Post Training and Qigong

The Post is one of the most useful training methods for Taijiquan. It teaches the body how to use and strengthen the correct muscles (especially the psoas) to move through the form with a vertical spine, while at the same time anchoring to the Earth by use of the breath. Also, it starts to tangibly bring to the body the processes of ‘emptying’ and ‘filling’ the different body parts, which is the basic dynamic of Yin and Yang that we study through this art. 

It is also an unparalleled training drill for self defense; it teaches how to keep your weight always on one leg without thinking about it, which allows to move faster and use the unweighted leg for kicking, for instance. 

The Qigong we’ll be training is the Three Circles Qigong, which is the mother posture of all standing qigong that gives rise to the moving form of qigong that Taijiquan is. Getting used subconsciously to the this structure and opening of the kua in a static manner, will set its application while we go through the moving versions of it, letting us focus instead in others aspects of external and internal structure of the form. 

These are the basic constituents of the Yang form, in terms of physical structure and movement.

results.description:
Seeking New Light: Neuroscience and The Path Toward Our Ethical Ideals

Speaker: Katherine LaClair 

Details: Felix Adler said, “We add to our moral worth in two ways; by living rightly, according to the light we already have, and by constantly seeking new light.” Katherine LaClair will offer some of the “new light” provided by neuroscience that can help us create a more humane society, and invite each of us to explore how these insights might contribute to our expressions of ethics.

*If you're interested in this topic, we also have a monthly discussion and study group for mind/brain issues and ethics: Your Brain on Ethics.


About the Speaker: Katherine LaClair grew up in New Jersey, attending the Sunday school at the Essex Ethical Culture Society with her beloved brother Matthew. She is a Ph.D. candidate at the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, and her research aims to understand the causes of Alzheimer’s disease. Katherine served for three years as the Chair of Ethical Action at the Baltimore Ethical Society, and is a licensed Ethical Culture officiant there. Katherine is now working to revitalize the AEU Ethical Action Committee as its current Chair. She enjoys crocheting, music, and tending to her garden and other living things.


Sunday programs are held at 11:00 AM at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. For more information, please visit our website: <a>http://www.rysec.org </a>;

results.name: Seeking New Light: Neuroscience and The Path Toward Our Ethical Ideals

results.description:
Please note that everyone will be waitlisted for this hike.  No one will be permitted unless you answer all RSVP questions.

Poor weather may cancel this hike.

This hike is more dangerous than most.  You may  be required to sign a waiver.  You will be off trail and scrambling on wet slippery terrain.  There are deep cracks and crevices into which you could fall and die.  

I will be keeping the group size  small and will give preference to those who have not been here before.  ( HVH leaders and other organizers on whose trips I've participated also get preference.)

Come join us as we explore the Ellenville Ice Caves "Primitive Zone" of the Sam's Point Preserve area of Minnewaska State Park Preserve. 

There are NO marked trails on this hike so be prepared to Bushwhack.  We will be exploring the Crevice and Cave-Like formations of this area.    At very least you should have hiked up Breakneck Ridge or similar and enjoyed it! (Or you loved climbing the jungle bars when your were a kid.)

Distance: Approximately 5 miles


Hiking Pace: Slow but physically challenging

Estimated Hike Time: 5-6 hours

Difficulty:  Rocky Terrain, Crevices and Caves with the strong possibility of some residual Ice from the winter

Organizer:  Rob Segal

Recommended Gear:

Climbing Helmet (Bicycle helmet will do) - I had an attendee on a previous visit to this preserve get hit in the head with a baseball size rock!

Gloves - Lightweight with good grip - Gardening gloves from Home Depot work great!

</a>

<a href="http://www.homedepot.com/p/West-Chester-Latex-Coated-String-Knit-Medium-Multi-purpose-Gloves-HD30502-MSPPS48/100398989#.UVogkVfzBQg">

Headlamp with spare batteries - Home Depot has a great 100 lumen headlamp for only $12.99!

<a href="http://www.homedepot.com/p/t/202968174?catalogId=10053&langId=-1&keyword=rayovac&storeId=10051&N=5yc1v&R=202968174#.UWDlulfzBQh"></a>

Water, Lunch, Snacks, First Aid Kit, etc.

On our trip we will cover such areas as Shingle Gully, the Grand Canyon (of the east) and the Flume Gorge in addition, of course, to the Ice Caves!.

Since only one small group per day is allowed, I ask you not sign up unless you are sure you want to go.  


++

results.description:
What made the Italian Renaissance one of the most innovative periods in history? We'll look at the rise of the creative individual and how the patronage of rulers, wealthy citizens and the Church produced a culture that revived classical art, architecture, science, literature and music and created a new economic and political order.
Suggested reading: The Civilization of the Renaissance in Italy by Jacob Burkhardt
results.name: Italian Renaissance

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12pm-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is FREE.  There is a suggested donation of $10 or whatever you feel comfortable with, as I do expend fees for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Sunday Drop-In Improv Class 12-3pm (FREE)

group.name: Improv NOW! - NYC Weekly Improv Classes

results.description:
We are excited to host the first Queen’s Code Graduate Brunch on Sunday, August 23, from 12noon-2pm. 

WHAT: This event is a time for all Queen’s Code (formerly Celebrating Men, Satisfying Women™) graduates to gather and discuss how Alison's teachings are impacting our lives and the lives of those around us. If you have not been able to attend this event before, it is highly recommended within our community! If you have not taken the Queen’s Code workshop, you can learn more about it on PAX's website. 

Graduates, check your email for the location details! 

DISCUSSION TOPIC: The Ideal Woman

What is your Ideal Woman telling you? What is she saying that you are too much or too little of? How is she helping you, or not helping you? How has your relationship with your Ideal Woman shifted since taking the Queen's Code? 

WHO MAY ATTEND: Due to the discussion topic, this event is only for graduates of the Queen’s Code workshop (formerly Celebrating Men, Satisfying Women™). 

TIME AND DATE: Sunday, August 23, 12noon-2pm

RSVP: Please RSVP for this meetup and we will email you information on location of the event. Graduates, check your email for location details! 


Please be sure to arrive on time or a few minutes early so that: - We can maximize the discussion time and - You do not miss any community updates at the beginning of the event. Additionally, In order to provide and preserve a safe space for those attending this event, we ask that you skip it if you will be more than 15 minutes late. We appreciate your partnership with us on this to ensure the event is a success for everyone attending. 

LOCATION: Brunch will be hosted at a restaurant in Chelsea. RSVP for the meetup and the location will be emailed to you.
results.name: Graduate Brunch - Topic: The Ideal Woman

results.description:
Finally after the long, hot summer the Serie A season returns this weekend. Juventus start the season at home taking on Udinese on Sunday. It's a noon start in NYC. Hope you'll join us at The Football Factory to kick off the club's[masked] campaign.

For any newcomers, the Football Factory is the downstairs bar at Legends on W 33rd Street (between 5th Avenue & Broadway) in Manhattan. Enter Legends, hang an immediate left and go downstairs. Look for the gang in black & white stripes!

Reminder also, that on Saturday, Team JuventiNYC is participating in Downtown United's NYC Supporters Club Cup at Pier 40 in Manhattan. Come out and watch if you're in the area - the games start at 9:00AM. We only had limited spots for players - apologies to those who requested to play after team was determined.

At any rate, hope that you all make it out on Sunday at 12:00PM. I remain in Europe so if anyone would like to volunteer to host this meetup, please let me know.

Fino alla fine e forza Juventus!

results.description:
Get on the water in NYC!  Come experience outrigger paddling for free.

This event will have outrigger paddling only.  

This event is open to the public on a first come, first served basis.

RSVPing to this meeup does not guarantee you a spot. However, your acknowledgement helps us plan our day to make sure we get you on the water as quickly as possible!

A completed waiver is required for participation.

Click here to fill out the waiver.

Location:  we are located at the sandy beach between Piers 3 & 5. Click here for a google map showing our location. 

Park Entrance: we are located directly north of the Joralemon Street entrance. 

Subway: the easiest way is to take the 2/3/4/5 to Borough Hall and walk west down Joralemon Street to the park.  You can also take the A/C or F train to Jay Street - MetroTech and once across Adams Street you can follow Joralemon Street down to the park.

The more adventurous can take the 2/3 to Clark St. or the A/C to High St. and cross into the park on the Squibb Park suspension bridge at the north end of the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. 

We paddle rain or shine except when there is lightening.  Remember to wear sunscreen and to bring a bottle of water in the canoe to stay hydrated. You are free to wear whatever you want provided you do not mind the possibility of it getting wet. You may want to consider bringing something dry you can change into afterwards. Assume anything you bring in the canoe will get soaked and/or lost.

The novice sessions will involve 10 minute introduction to familiarize you with the technique, commands and safety protocol of the canoe. This is then followed by a 20 minute session on the water.

More details can be found at: http://newyorkoutrigger.org/novices/program-description/
results.name: Free Outrigger Paddling at Brooklyn Bridge Park's Pier 4

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:
results.how_to_find_us: Price per class is $25.00 (first class is free, but you must RSVP).Tell the receptionist you are here for Krav Maga and turn right to the Martial arts room- cant miss us.

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
"Regarded with reverence" is my favorite definition of the sacred. Something that is sacred is something that adds value to our life. It's often woven with meaning, symbolism and ritual but not always. It may be a tiny moment where you pause to touch your favorite tree, a boundary you hold worthy, a candle you light for prayer or a friendship you tend with honor. 

Here are some of the questions we will be discussing:


What is sacred?


What is sacred to you?

What remains sacred in society?

Has sacredness been lost in modern times? How so?


How can we live a sacred life full of depth and meaning, in our current society?


**I encourage everyone to leave a bit of extra time afterwards to connect with women in the group on a personal level to keep actively building community.


T shop


247 Elizabeth St
New York, NY 10012 b/t Houston St & Prince St
MTA Bleecker St. or Broadway-Lafayette or Prince St. depending on your train.


tshopny.com
results.how_to_find_us: T shop is a tiny Taiwanese tea shop located behind the psychic reader. My number is 917-717-8275 if you need it.
results.name: Discussion: The Importance of Sacredness

PLEASE GO TO GOLDSTAR.COM !! AND RESERVE REDUCED $26 PRICE TICKETS!!! 3:00 PM  (TICKETS SELL OUT!! GO IMMEDIATELY TO GOLDSTAR.COM!! REGULAR PRICE IS $45) 

"Bombshell of Rhythm"

Tells the True Story of Bandleader Ina Ray Hutton

@

Soho Playhouse,  15 Vandam Street New York City, NY 10013 

PRICE- $22.50*  ($28.00 with fee) 

Buy Now

 Ina Ray Hutton, conductor of the all-girl band The Melodears, was the most successful female bandleader of the big band era -- and the first woman to conduct male bands in the '40s and have her own TV show in the '50s. In Bombshell of Rhythm (The Life & Secrets of Ina Ray Hutton), the unforgettable legacy of her life unfolds, from the moment her tap-dancing abilities were recognized by a vaudeville producer when she was just a child all the way through her decades-spanning career in entertainment, harboring a secret she couldn't reveal. This production of Bombshell of Rhythm, written and performed by Melissa Ritz at New York City's SoHo Playhouse, is accompanied by 14 songs from the big band era.

The usual Sunday PFS games.  We're casual, so any aspiring GMs can feel free to organize a group in addition to our current GM, Fat Moose has room for two to three tables if need be.  Society starts promptly at 12:00, because we are locked into a 5 hour slot we need to be efficient.  As the organizer I'll be setting up tables an hour before start time so if anyone has questions they can feel free to show up a bit early.

We have a small stock of scenarios available for GMs to run but if anyone finds a Scenario we don't have and would like to play it feel free to purchase it and bring it to your GM the day of.  If you're going to do this though try and show up early so he can review the scenario before running it.

results.description:
Updated April 18th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate 
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien 
[masked]


MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

results.name: Sunday Ultimate @ 12PM, Morningside Park

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP with eventbrite

http://jocwhitewateraug2015.eventbrite.com/


=======================================

Join the JOC for a fun-filled dam release day on the Level 2-3 Lehigh River

Whitewater raft the action packed Lehigh River Gorge and experience the best whitewater in the tri-state area! Surrounded by state park protected woodlands and mountains, you will enjoy 12 miles and 5 hours of Class III whitewater rafting and outstanding scenery. This is a fun, thrilling, and pristine whitewater rafting trip that everyone from ages 8 and up can do…no experience necessary! While paddling over 17 rapids you’ll scream, laugh and have an amazing day..

PRICING:
$69.5 early bird until August 13th
$75 after August 13th (subject to availability)
Does not include compensation to your driver.

WHAT IS THE LOCATION?
Pocono Whitewater
1519 State Route 903
Jim Thorpe, PA 18229
N40°56.762’ W075°39.225’
(a little over 2 hours from NYC)


HOW DO I GET THERE IF I DON'T HAVE A CAR?
We will email a carpool spreadsheet but it is your responsibility to secure a ride.
Each passenger will be expected to reimburse their driver $23 from NYC ($18 from Northern NJ and Monsey)
for gas, tolls, and wear & tear.

WHAT IF IT RAINS?
light rain will not cancel, but a major storm will.
In the case we have to cancel, we will reschedule .
Please check your email in case we have to cancel due to a major storm.

To sign up and pay please click on the link below. If you only select going on the Facebook event without signing up on Eventbrite, you will not be guaranteed a spot.

http://jocwhitewateraug2015.eventbrite.com/

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
There is always high demand for figure sessions, but I don't have the time to organize more. So my friend (artist extraordinaire) Simon has offered to host some weekly sessions. These events won't impact the regular schedule of the group; they're additional. Hope to see you there! - Jesse

Join us for Saturday figure sketching, at a beautiful space conveniently located in Union Square! We'll be in Suite 505.

Unlike our outdoor Meetups, this one costs money so we can pay for the space and models. It's $15 per person, pay at the door. These sessions tend to be in high demand, so only RSVP if you are pretty sure you will attend! If not, please open the spot for someone else.

Any problems on the day of the event, Simon can be reached at [masked]. 

Looking forward to sketching with you!


What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!


• We sketch for a bit, and then take a break and share our drawings. Then we sketch some more, etc.

• Feel free to bring any media you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos (not of the model) to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• The event will last three hours.

• Everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to the attending list.


Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.
results.name: Weekly Figure Drawing in Union Square

group.name: Central Park Sketching & Art Meetup Group

results.description:
Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of Union Square.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  


• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
This is the third of several sails we'll be doing this year in conjunction with the South Street Seaport Museum.

Please order your tickets directly from the museum's Website! (RSVPs from this Meetup page will not be honored):
https://web.ovationtix.com/trs/pr/947114/prm/DM823


This event will be both exciting and relaxing at the same time! Exciting: sailing on a 130 year old cast iron schooner around the tip of Manhattan, the Manhattan skyline, three great art models, a sailboat crew at work around you, having the chance to volunteer hauling up the sails. Relaxing: enjoying the pleasant sail, watching the water and the sights go by as you draw and paint.  

There's no more fun way to spend a Sunday afternoon! So bring your favorite art materials and some friends who need a lift (and maybe even some refreshments), and expect to have a great time!


Regular ticket price is $45 per person. Our group will have a special discount code for $10 off.

Wanna know how much fun people had on the last Draw-mania! Sail? Look!
https://youtu.be/H_V7jVk-ytk

Learn how to wire wrap crystals to create spiritually inspired one-of-a-kind jewelry at our Crystal Wire Wrapping Workshop!

In this workshop you will learn two basic wire wrapping techniques that will allow you to create customized jewelry for your needs. During the workshop, we will also discuss on how to cleanse and program your stones for your use.

Martha Vallejo the owner of Crystal Path Creations has made crystal wire jewelry for Namaste Book and Gift shop as well as OM Namaste, where she currently works. Martha also teaches metaphysical classes and intuitive wire jewelry workshops.


https://www.etsy.com/shop/CrystalPathCreations

https://www.facebook.com/crystalpathcreations

Martha Vallejo will be teaching the workshop on crystal wrapping and renowned psychic and healer, Laura Schwalm will be providing mini-readings for clients who are interested! During these readings, clients can ask questions regarding their health, finances, romance and spirituality. The rate of the mini-readings will be $30.00 for 15 minutes.

During the workshop, tools and materials will be supplied, but feel free to bring along your own crystals to work with. Everyone will leave with at least two ready-to-wear healing crystal necklaces by the conclusion of the workshop.

If you are interested in just taking the crystal wire workshop the price is $30.00. Packages include:  Crystal Wire Wrapping Workshop and one mini-reading for $50.00, or Two readings and the workshop for $60.00.

Wine, cheese and light refreshments will be served! Please come on time. Cash and credit cards are accepted. 

If you have any other inquiries about the workshop or are going to be late please text at[masked]

Love and light,

Laura Schwalm

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

results.description:
Shalom,


I've arranged for 10 free VIP tickets to the Off-Broadway show, Odd Birdz (by Israeli theater troupe, Tziporela - ציפורלה)

It's supposed to be a very funny and special show. 

Tickets will be provided by RSVP order so hurry up :)

The show is on Sunday 8/23/15 at 2:00 pm, so let's meet up at 1:30 pm, collect the tickets, have a little chat and enjoy the show.

If there is interest, we can do something after the show.

See y'all Sunday,

Aviv

https://vimeo.com/135839289

About Tziporella:

http://tziporela.com/


The hard-working cast of eight is very talented." – NY Post 

“Ultra-charismatic… The company’s exuberance is contagious.” – The New York Times 

“The multifaceted cast is outstanding.” – Theatre Is Easy “A fiercely talented crew!” – The Huffington Post 

"There is no doubt that these deft professionals truly understand what different cultures find funny" – Broadway World 

ABOUT TZIPORELA’S ODD BIRDZ Inventively weaving together movement, music, physical theatre, and outrageous comedy, the show creates an evening of hilarious entertainment that transcends barriers of language, culture, and age. Odd Birdz is composed of twenty fast-paced vignettes that incorporate a brilliant mix of humor, music, dance and drama. The “fiercely talented crew” as Huffington Post calls them, is comprised of nine versatile members who met twelve years ago at Israel’s top acting studio, Nissan Nativ, and have been collaborating ever since. Together they have written, directed, designed, choreographed, and produced countless innovative theatrical experiences; sold out performances for a decade; and with their accessible, universal material have developed a loyal fan base of all ages from around the world.

Sunday, August 23rd in Central Park

Join us this Sunday in Central Park for a unique meditation meetup for wealth and abundance creation from the vedic perspective! 

WEALTH: If we don’t have it, we have greed to attain it. If we have it, we have fear of losing it. If we are somewhere in between, we have worry about how to maintain it!

But through meditation and clearing the stress and money worries, we can start welcoming and enjoying abundance in our lives!

The first step to becoming wealthy is creating a wealthy consciousness!

Benefits of of this Vedic Meditation:

• Learn how to unclutch from money problems, money worries, money stress

• Invite abundance in to your life with ease

• Enjoy a more harmonious relationship with wealth and money-making

JOIN US AS WE LEARN THIS SIMPLE YET POWERFUL MEDITATION FROM ENLIGHTENED HINDU MASTER, PARAMAHAMSA NITHYANANDA!

results.description:
Hi Rooftop Drinkers,


Meet us at 2 p.m. in Columbus Circle (be on time please as we'll leave at 2 p.m.) for a great bike ride to Bayside Queens and their newest rooftop bar at The Bourbon Street Cafe. As of this posting, the bar isn't even open, but Lara, the lovely manager, promises it'll be open before Aug 23 for us. 


For those who don't ride bikes, take the LIRR Port Washington Line to Bayside and the rooftop is very close by. Shoot for getting there around 4ish. As for getting back, you can ride or take the train, probably depending on how much you drink :)


There is a great menu of food and cocktails so come hungry!

Cheers!

Leslie
results.how_to_find_us: We'll ride over the 59th Street Bridge, through Queens out to Bayside to the Bourbon Street Cafe, which is opening a brand-new rooftop bar/restaurant. For those who don't bike, take the LIRR Port Washington Line to Bayside and it's right there.

results.description:
We all strive in life to reach certain goals.  But often we encounter elements beyond our control that can hamper our progress.  These may come in the form of bad luck manifesting in financial difficulties, health issues, problems in the workplace, relationship troubles, and any and all of the troubles we all face.  It may seem at times that we’re going nowhere fast.

We do all we can to counteract these difficulties yet they only seem to mount up, causing even greater issues in our lives.  Most of us can attest to the truth of the folklore that tells us that trouble comes in threes!  Our society would have us believe that you must stay motivated and work hard.  You are then directed to a life coach or motivational speaker to rally your emotions and convince you to do what you’re told by the mainstream.  But this only serves to mask the issues we face.  Many Western religions also teach this very same idea but attribute most of our ills to the devil.  So you are told that this evil, all-powerful entity is picking on you and that you need God in your life.  But what they really mean is that the preacher wants your obedience, time, and money in return for vanquishing the devil.

If you really look at our modern lives closely, many of the so-called remedies to your difficulties have a secret agenda.  For example, modern medicine is not interested in curing the most common ailments but rather prolonging them so as to keep the profits coming in from generations of expensive medication purchases.  The pharmaceutical companies will never, ever, tell you that you have the power within you to heal yourself.

But let’s get back to these obstructions in our lives.  We are given many external means that claim to combat them, as we mentioned above, but yet never are we told what may have caused these issues.  In most cases the blame is placed solely and directly on you.  If you have financial difficulties you are then told by society that you must manage your money better.  But did you really mismanage your finances in the first place?


When a talented young actress goes to several auditions and gets rejected time and time again she is told to keep trying.  Then as the years pass the strong faith that her family and friends once had starts to dwindle.  They then begin the process of blaming, telling her that maybe she is not that great an actress and that she should start considering another career.

When a young college graduate heads into the job market and lands several great job interviews, but ends up not getting that final job offer, then excuses come into play.  Maybe he gets told that he’s overqualified, hasn’t got enough experience, the job market is poor at this time, that companies are window shopping yet not hiring. Even worse, then other factors may come up such as racism or sexism or even perhaps it’s who you know.  While these factors can all sadly play a part in how others discriminate against their fellow humans, we are constantly told that this is the way the world is rather than that we should be enabled to achieve.

We look around us and in the modern media and see those with lots of wealth who are not as talented as us yet they are extremely successful.  The truth seems to incorporate this main factor: your destiny is fated and you need to follow a certain path.  This is an agreement you made before coming to earth so there are certain experiences in life you will have to go through in order to learn and grow. But the specific area we are concerned with here is the spirit or spirits.  Like guardian angels we all have a spirit either working on our behalf or causing trouble in our lives.  These spirits are meant to coexist or live in perfect harmony with one another.  However, when one or maybe even two go amok then there is an imbalance and you experience what feels like bad luck or obstructions in your life.

Since these spirits reside within and around us, they can manifest in many different ways.  The key to your success in life is knowing how to communicate with them so that you always achieve a perfect balance.  Many in the New Age movement refer to these spirits as energies or chakras.  It doesn’t matter what you call them though!  The net result is the same.  They are either working for your success or against it. And if they are working out of harmony then you need to find out what they or it needs to get back into alignment with the whole.

Each spirit is assigned a place and function by God.  They are always with and around you, existing in the background and helping you along the way.  The problem is that we have been conditioned by society not to believe and trust in these spirits or energies and to ignore them entirely.  This leads to the spirits not getting the nurturing they need and need to give back.  When this happens they start to cause havoc in your life not as a means to do evil but to alert you to the fact that you need to do some emotional house cleaning!  Meaning, the spirits need you to work with them and take care of them.  And you if take care of them they will take care of you.


The end result will be health and wealth in your life if you build that relationship with them.  Remember, they are in your corner and ready to fight for you.  The key is that you must learn how to communicate with them in order to achieve the success you’ve always wanted in life.

In this FREE session you will learn:

• Which spirits are within you and which ones are you personally working with on a daily basis

• What the spirits names are

• What is your dominant spirit and why

• What is your weakest spirit and why

• How to communicate with your spirits to get them into balance

• How to ask for special favors

• How to send them out on secret missions for you

• Why they are out of balance and causing you trouble

• What is it that they need from you

Register for your session now.  Spaces are limited.  This session will be dedicated to the Goddess Maat, Goddess of Truth and Balances.  Donations to her are welcomed but not obligatory!
results.name: How To Communicate With Spirits

results.description:
Please join us on Sunday, 8/23, from 2:00 – 7:30 pm, for the 7th Annual NYC Friends of Clearwater Water Festival! We will be celebrating the music and activism of RAY KORONA. It’s a FREE CONCERT, a potluck, and the opportunity to hear wonderful environmental educators.

This theme of this year’s festival is “EFFICIENCY IS SEXY!”
Everyone appreciates solar and wind, but efficiency and conservation changes the conversation!

Ken Gale from NYC Safe Energy Campaign, who is a long-time member of NYC Friends of Clearwater and the host/producer of Eco-Logic on WBAI-FM moderates.

Speakers include:
Marilyn Elie - Indian Point Safe Energy Coalition
Wyldon Fishman - NY Solar Energy Society & Green Energy Times
Tom Wysmuller - International climate and energy lecturer
Tim Judson - Nuclear Information & Resource Service
And a special tribute from friends of Ray Korona

Musicians include:
Ray Korona Band - Ivice, Barry Kornhauser, Ellen Davidson and Gina Tlamsa
Jenny Hurwitz / Peter Pasco / NYC Streetsingers / NY Metro Raging Grannies/ Chris Lang / Judy Gorman / and other inspiring performers

Location:
Lower East Side Ecology Center (on the East River, park entrance on Cherry St)

See link for directions: http://www.lesecologycenter.org/index.php/about/directions.html

EDUCATE ♦ ADVOCATE ♦ CELEBRATE ♦ COMMUNITY!

♦ Conservation ♦ Reuse ♦ Recycle ♦

“Like minded people partying together”

Show off your cooking or bring something store bought to share for our potluck!

www.nycfriendsofclearwater.org https://www.facebook.com/nycfriendsofclearwater
nycsloopclub@gmail.com
Or call Donna at (212)[masked] to volunteer, or for more information about this event!
results.name: NYC Friends of Clearwater 7th Annual Water Festival

results.description:
This is a consistent title that pops up on Summer reading lists.

On the faded Island Books sign hanging over the porch of the Victorian cottage is the motto "No Man Is an Island; Every Book Is a World." A. J. Fikry, the irascible owner, is about to discover just what that truly means.

A. J. Fikry's life is not at all what he expected it to be. His wife has died, his bookstore is experiencing the worst sales in its history, and now his prized possession, a rare collection of Poe poems, has been stolen. Slowly but surely, he is isolating himself from all the people of Alice Island-from Lambiase, the well-intentioned police officer who's always felt kindly toward Fikry; from Ismay, his sister-in-law who is hell-bent on saving him from his dreary self; from Amelia, the lovely and idealistic (if eccentric) Knightley Press sales rep who keeps on taking the ferry over to Alice Island, refusing to be deterred by A.J.'s bad attitude. Even the books in his store have stopped holding pleasure for him. These days, A.J. can only see them as a sign of a world that is changing too rapidly.

And then a mysterious package appears at the bookstore. It's a small package, but large in weight. It's that unexpected arrival that gives A. J. Fikry the opportunity to make his life over, the ability to see everything anew. It doesn't take long for the locals to notice the change overcoming A.J.; or for that determined sales rep, Amelia, to see her curmudgeonly client in a new light; or for the wisdom of all those books to become again the lifeblood of A.J.'s world; or for everything to twist again into a version of his life that he didn't see coming. As surprising as it is moving, "The Storied Life of A. J. Fikry" is an unforgettable tale of transformation and second chances, an irresistible affirmation of why we read, and why we love.
results.name: "The Storied Life of A.J. Fikry", by Gabrielle Zevin

Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

The evening's focus will be on "older," "more popular" games (such as Catan, Carcassonne, Dominion, Puerto Rico, Ticket to Ride, Power Grid, etc.) so that newer players can get a solid introduction to these new styles of board games. If your image of "board game" is Sorry, Life, Backgammon, Monopoly, Risk, etc. there's a whole new, better genre waiting for you! (Veteran games and gamers still welcome, of course.)

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.

results.description:
1961. France. Directed by Jean-Pierre Melville. Screenplay by Melville, from the novel by Béatrix Beck. With Jean-Paul Belmondo, Emmanuelle Riva, Nicole Mirel. In occupied France, the widow of a Communist resistant (Emmanuelle Riva), who has been forced to send her half-Jewish daughter into hiding, is further troubled by her powerful attraction to her female boss (Nicole Mirel) and her dying faith in God. Comfort comes in the unexpected form of a young Catholic priest (Jean-Paul Belmondo), whose attempts to rekindle the widow’s faith stir other awakenings as well. Melville’s film places two newly minted stars of the French New Wave in a spare, classical context, charged with suppressed eroticism. Riva, familiar to contemporary audiences for Michael Haneke’s Amour, creates a strikingly complex character for a director not usually known for his characterizations of women. In French, English subtitles. 117 min.
http://www.moma.org/visit/calendar/film_screenings/24395
-------------------------
Double feature week!

I think this will be more interesting than the title suggests. I have not seen this but Jean-Pierre Melville is a minor deity so we cannot go wrong. Movie is at 2:30 and I will be outside 15-20 before to intercept people. The movie is in Theater 1. The directions say to go to the entrance east of the main entrance on 53rd Street. If you cannot find me then just go to the theater. I will be outside the theater entrance until the projector starts.

Like we did last summer, we will sing Broadway & pop tunes, along with recorded CDs on a BOSE speaker for great accompaniment. We will have full music scores of the pieces.

TIME:

We sing at 3 pm but you need to be there by 2:30 to put your music into your folder and set up! The music must be returned right after the performance.

DRESS:

Please wear black slacks and black shoes. Wear a brightly colored SOLID COLOR top (that means all one color, no prints, no designs). If you have any 'stage props' you like to use, i.e. party hats, top hats, American flag, boas, etc., please bring and use at your discretion.

EXPRESS YOURSELF, SMILE, DANCE AROUND if you like, ENGAGE our AUDIENCE! The more we do, the more they respond.

Bring your water bottle. NO scented products of any kind.

The Sunrise residents and staff loved us last year and are really looking forward to a pick-me-up with our big smiles, voices, and enthusiasm! Please RSVP to Linda.

Note: There will be informal "rehearsals" - really singing along with the CDs - on Tuesday June 16 at 7:00 pm and on Tuesday June 23 at 7:00 pm. If you are free either or both nights, RSVP to Linda so I know how many chairs to set up. We'll run the music, usually done in an hour or so.

We will also perform the same program in the end of August, date TBA.

-Wear comfortable clothing. Bring a pen/notepad. Bring a yoga mat (rentals available at studio). 

-$15 cash at door

Workshop hosted by Adriana Rambay Fernández, RYT-200. A Kripalu-certified teacher, Adriana offers gentle and moderate classes that support the process of self-discovery and healing through guided meditation, asana, and pranayama. Through an open, receptive, and steady approach she guides students to a place of inner balance, harmony, and union. She believes yoga can unlock inner creativity, healing, and a deepened sense of awareness. Find out more about Adriana at:

 http://adrianarambay.com/

results.description:
Free. Manhattan. Sunday, August 23rd @ 2:30PM

Gotham Yacht Club is looking for fun sailors and non-sailors to join us this weekend for a birthday celebration!

We take trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson--the Statue of Liberty to the George Washington Bridge--but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required, but preference is given to experienced sailors since the trips can’t happen without them.  As space is limited on the boat, simply RSVP’ing “Yes” to an event does not guarantee a spot on the boat.  If a spot is available, you will be contacted directly with event details.

Sailors can take their first trip to get acquainted and enjoy the party.  From then on, sailors can choose to (1) work the morning shift and help out with the launch or (2) work the evening shift and help out with the return.  Generally, sailors spend less than a third of the trip working and can take the rest of the time to relax and socialize.

The current crew is made up of young, educated Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat. 

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to [masked]. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you directly.  Since boat trips fill up in advance and we receive many applicants, we may not get back to you immediately.  

We look forward to seeing you on the water!

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?


Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to [masked].

Thank you!


FAQ


Q: Do you have to pay to attend a boat party?


A: No, all boat parties are absolutely free.  You may want to bring food and drinks, which are on a potluck basis.


Q: The specific location is not listed.  Where do we meet for the boat party?


A: Unfortunately, we cannot fit everyone who RSVPs to a MeetUp event onto the boat.  There are some crew members and attendees who are not part of the MeetUp group, so there may be less space than it appears.  In order to avoid miscommunication and needing to leave people on the dock, specific details (including meeting location) are sent to members individually.  If you do not receive an invitation via email, you will not be able to attend that week’s boat party.


Q: How often are the boat parties?


A: Boat parties are generally every weekend, either on a Saturday or Sunday. They generally last all afternoon into the early evening. 


Q: Do I have to fill out the questionnaire?


A: Yes! Please fill out the questionnaire as thoroughly as possible.  If you are uncomfortable posting any of the information on your profile, please email your responses to [masked].  Without a complete application, you will not be considered to receive an invitation.  The trips last several hours, so we will have 20-30 people in a confined space for an extended period of time. Therefore, we need to have an idea of who we are inviting on the boat and ensure that we have a proper crew.  Please fill out the questionnaire if you are interested in sailing with Gotham Yacht Club.
results.name: Sunday Sailing Birthday Party!

The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
Hello Everyone!

ALL LEVELS WELCOME


Also check out my website www.tennis-buffs.com



Packanack Lake Tennis Club (only 20-30 min from the GWB)

9 Osborne Terrace, Wayne 07470

10 outdoor red clay and hard courts

$40 includes tennis, balls and BBQ

 

All levels welcome


IF YOU'RE SIGNING UP THROUGH MEETUP AND IT'S YOUR FIRST TIME -- YOU MUST CALL OR EMAIL ME.  I would like to stagger players to come different hours.

Spend Sunday afternoon with old and new friends playing tennis and having BBQ at Packanack Lake!  For those who haven't been to the Lake, it's like being at a resort or in your own backyard with a nice deck, overlooking clay courts.  When you are there, you will not think about anything else except fun and relaxation.  All levels are welcome.  You will play 3 hours of tennis depending on how many people sign up.  Bring your friends and families.  The More the Merrier!


 

GENERAL ANNOUNCEMENTS
RESPECT FOR SPACE WE SHARE
Please pick up after yourself when you finish eating.  It spoils the environment for everybody else while they're sitting out and socializing during their off hour, sharing the same area.  It's nice to have respect for the space we all share.  Please help me, as I'm juggling many things to create a fun evening for everyone.

BALLS ON COURT
A friendly reminder, please find the 3 balls that you played with and place them by the net for the next group of players.  Often people cannot find the balls or they are mixed in with old balls, not ones from the night's party.

HAND BALLS TO SERVER
Be considerate and wait for the server or the partner to turn around before sending balls over the net.  It's safer, saves time and just good court etiquette.

BE SUPPORTIVE OF YOUR PARTNER
Every once in a while we need to be reminded that we keep a positive attitude on the court.  People come for the enjoyment of the game and to meet other people in a social setting.  Please be a sportsman and be supportive of your partner.  It isn't fun for anyone on the court to see discontent being shown through facial expressions, body language or even scolding.  Let's keep the parties fun and enjoy the evening.

 


Look forward to meeting old and new friends at the next parties!

Thanks,
Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

3:50-4:59 pm  Registration / Check-in (Name tags) -"$2 fee"

results.description:
YES!!!  Here is a good aerial map of Cherry Hill.  Midpark West on 72nd St. 

The red arrow is pointing to the spot where we meet

Here's the interactive map: http://www.nycbirds.com/mapCPK.html

Summer will be ending soon. For our August Meetup let's meet at Central Park's Cherry Hill and join in a group meditation and discussion of the benefits of TM you've noticed since learning TM. Hopefully those who were not able to join us for our previous meetups will be able to come out for this Sunday event!  We'll start with group meditation after everyone arrives at 4:15 p.m.

***We'll be providing an alternate meetup location if there is rain, so please check back for updates.

IF YOU HAVE NOT YET LEARNED TM: Although we welcome newcomers to TM, the NY TM Meetup Group focuses on creating events for those who have already learned the practice. It is not an opportunity to learn TM. If you have not already learned the TM practice you can do so by contacting a local center at TM.org.

The first step to learn the Transcendental Meditation technique (TM) is a free intro talk to find out about TM — what it is, what benefits come from practicing, what's involved in learning, etc. You can attend a free intro talk every Sunday at 1:30 p.m., and every Thursday at Noon and 6:30 p.m. at the Midtown TM center, and every Sunday at 2:00 p.m., and every Wednesday at 12:30 p.m. and 7:00 p.m. at the Downtown TM center.

The meetup events, on the other hand, are not well suited for those who have not yet started TM since we start them with group TM practice, and then have a discussion about TM. 

If you'd like to attend one of the intro talks mentioned above, the address is: 654 Madison Ave., Suite 805. You can call the center number [masked]) for the Midtown center, and 26 Beaver St., phone:[masked] to register for any of the intro talks.

results.description:
Photographers!

We are returning to the amazing Shore Line Trolley Museum in East Haven CT August 23rd! It's been 3 years since our last visit, so if you are interested in joining us do not let this opportunity pass you by! This time we will be visiting after hours which means we will have the museum / trains to ourselves! (and beat the heat!) We'll hop aboard one of the historic trolleys that will take us through the scenic Branford salt marshes near Long Island Sound out to the tracks and other cars. They even have some new acquisitions they are allowing us access to~ a 1907 mail car and a perfectly restored CT company car with luggage racks which has never been opened to the public!

                                         (Foxy Vermouth by Cliff Henderson)

This is an INCREDIBLE location!

Take a look here, and be sure to look at their photo gallery:

http://shorelinetrolley.org/


                                                   (Stockholm Filly by Presta Imagery)

Shoot will run 4:30-7:30

Price as follows:

RSVP by 8/8 for the early bird rate : $75

RSVP by 8/12 for $85

RSVP by 8/17 for $95

RSVP by 8/22 for $105

Price at the door: $120

                                                             (Joey by Presta Imagery)

Models TBA!


1) Kitty Katastrophe ~ https://www.facebook.com/kittykatastropheburlesque

http://www.kittykatastrophe.com/


2) Sadie Century ~ https://instagram.com/sadiecentury/

3) Samantha ~ http://www.modelmayhem.com/711813

First time with the club!

4) Dot Mitzvah ~ http://dotmitzvahonline.com

Facebook.com/thedotmitzvah

First time with the club!


                       (Foxy Vermouth by Phroso Photo / Jason Lee)

How do I get there?

We recommend driving! But if you are interested in taking public transportation, it is possible.

By Public Transit: 

CT Transit’s F Line bus to East Haven/Branford passes within a few blocks of the trolley museum.  Tell the driver you wish to disembark at the East Haven Green.


They’ll be sure to announce it. Once at the Green, walk to the south side, along the cemetery, which is River Street. Follow River St. away from downtown 3 blocks to the end of the street – this is where the museum is located. Total walking time from the Green to the museum is 5-10 minutes.

Via Metro-North or Amtrak:

Disembark Metro-North or Amtrak train at New Haven Union Station. Proceed to the street side of the station and wait for/board the Union Station Shuttle bus – it’s painted lime green. The shuttle runs on a 15 minute loop. Ask the driver where at the New Haven Green to transfer to the F Line bus to East Haven/Branford.

Transfer to the F Line CT Transit bus, then follow the bus directions above.

Find CT Transit bus schedules above.

ALL ABOARD!

                                                                 (Megan By Presta Imagery)

Please note, these shoots take lots of time and effort to plan. Payments are non-refundable and non-transferable.

                                        (Kitty Katastrophe by Cliff Henderson)

Interested in modeling at this shoot?  We cast experienced models for each shoot, and there are a very limited number of spots available. Please email us a link to your portfolio or Model Mayhem page by clicking the link "contact the organizers."  We will notify you if we'd like to have you join us for this one! (Please mention where it is you would be traveling from and if you have a car; remember:  this shoot is in CT!)

                                    (Malinka Kalinka by Presta Imagery)
