*This meetup is part of our "New York City Weekend" line up of events from August 20th-23rd, 2015 that allows locals and those who do not live in Nyc an opportunity to enjoy "The Single One In The Group Meetup Events" together! 

This is a Free event! 

Join us as we enjoy the beautiful voice of Grammy nominated artist Jasmine Sullivan. This event will take place on the final day of our weekend of events... after the mimosas have worn off from brunch and we've had some time to get out of our "church clothes" and even slip a nap in. lol

We will be meeting up at Rumsey Playfield in Central Park. The doors open at 6:00 pm and the show starts at 7:00 pm so I would suggest no later than a 4:30 pm meet up time so that we can get in line and secure a great spot with a nice view. (These concerts tend to draw large crowds).
results.name: New York City Weekend: Jasmine Sullivan via Summerstage!

group.name: "The Single One In The Group" Social Events

results.description:
*Sorry everybody! I accidentally deleted this entry, and I apologize if you already signed up for this session!

Join DM Noah Anderson for this second chapter of Wildpig Exclusive "Sailing Against the Wind" for PCs of level 4!

The battle ended poorly. Terrible beasts and deadly magic set both Pirate and Navy adrift. Now, with only wreckage between them and open ocean around them, two foes must become one crew. Perhaps then, they may survive. Will you find salvation... or ultimate sacrifice?
results.name: D&D 5E: SATW - The Flotsam Alliance

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)

results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on the writing portion of the TOEFL test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Sundays from 5:00pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

 ****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating. 

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:


日時:日曜日の午後5時～7時 (毎週二時間単位で行います)

場所: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

費用: イベントのご参加は無料ですが教材の出費を緩和致しますため、$5の推奨ドネーション額をお支払い下さい。

ご予約は以下まで: （予約なしでもご参加ＯＫです）
[masked]

ご質問のある方はメールまでお問い合わせください。

皆様のお越しをお待ちしております。
results.name: TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop ・ TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座

results.description:
Join CITY WINERY, Lyons Den Power Yoga and YOGASMOGA for a free vino and vinyasa even at the South Street Seaport Sunday, August 23 at 5:00 p.m. 

City Winery strives to deliver the highest-end combined culinary and cultural experience to their customers who are passionate in sharing wine, music, and culinary arts. They are a unique facility, combining a fully functioning winery with intimate concerts, food & wine classes, private events in a variety of configurations, and fine dining. They have created a compelling mix for their sophisticated clientele of foodies, and active cultural patrons—bringing the wine country experience to the middle of a large city.


Lyons Den Power Yoga's mission is to empower you to live boldly and courageously. From a physical perspective, the power is indicative of the poses and flow of practice. The poses we use will focus on building strength, balance and flexibility while moving from one pose to the next. Power Yoga is a physical practice that opens up possibilities on and off the mat.


Lyons Den Power Yoga is Manhattan’s only yoga studio dedicated to teaching Hot Power Vinyasa Yoga in the Baptiste Yoga™ Method. We are excited to be in TriBeCa and invite you to join us in creating a vibrant community in the heart of New York City.

YOGASMOGA in partnership with South Street Seaport and Pop Up Mob is hosting its first ever pop up shop in New York City. As a New York based company we are very excited to have the opportunity to host three events a week on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays while our pop up is open from August 1st - September 10th.

Please RSVP at [masked]!


**Mats provided**
results.name: Vino & Vinyasa with CITY WINERY and Lyons Den Power Yoga
Round Of Each , Nl Holdem And Omaha

results.description:
Somebody suggested this place as a good pizza spot. You know I LOVE pizza. Our last Pizza meetup was such a success so let's do it again at a new spot! This place has great reviews and looks like the pizza is brick oven style. 

They have a WHOLE vegan pizza menu! Check it out here !

For this meetup it is ESSENTIAL that we are on time. The place opens at 5 and does not take reservations. If we all want to sit together we gotta get in there! Also nobody likes waiting for pizza!



Looks like we can do like last time and order some pies and share!  Please bring cash (maybe about $15 or more for tip) so we can make paying easier!


Can't wait to GRUB!!!!

I'll be going to a free comedy show in DUMBO that evening if anybody wants to join!
results.name: Paulie Gee's Vegan Pizza in Greenpoint Brooklyn!

results.description: I just moved here and want to make this a weekly meetup. Come join me! JD Samson ( Le Tigre, MEN) and The Rusty Knot present a weekly Sunday afternoon Tea Dance on the Hudson River. You will find amazing LGBTQ DJ's as well as cheap beers, delicious food, incredible blended and iced cocktails, a nautical theme, a space age pool table, friendly bartenders and views of a beautiful sunset. Smiles are all over the place here.
results.name: Scissor Sundays

venue.name: Bayonne Park Wooden Gazebo Lower Level By the Water (48th St.)

results.description:
Meet at the wooden gazebo located at the 48th St. side of the park at the lower level by the water. It's located not too far from the bathrooms near the street ramp. You can also click the location link near the meetup date & time for a Google Earth GPS view of the meetup location.

The walk will take approximately 45-60 minutes depending on how much we walk. We can walk more if the group decides to. I'll wait around 5 minutes before walking. If you're running late, post a notification and we'll wait. 

Please update your RSVP if you can't make it. We will not walk if it rains. Also, I recommend wearing sneakers to the walks. If you have any questions/comments/concerns, you can post a notification or email me through the meetup site.
results.name: Sunday Walk Around Bayonne and Rutkowski Parks

results.description:
Alright so we need to start doing some in-person meeting up and strategizing about how to engineer this Bernie victory! Establish our aims and goals.


I guess at the Boardwalk we should meet by the Dolphins before finding a place to sit!


Please "Like" our Facebook page here: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Staten-Island-NYC-for-Bernie/1601159226807278?ref=bookmarks

And also join our Facebook group here for discussion: https://www.facebook.com/groups/397896803736444/

I wanted to gather as much Staten Island Bernie support as possible, however this need not be limited to Staten Island and we could meet in other boroughs.


There is a Discussion forum on the MeetUp group page (Click "Discussions" on top) if you would prefer to share your thoughts there.

MeetUp has some extra tools for helping to attract new members and organize things, it's still early in the election season, but I'm hoping this group can play a role in helping Bernie 2016.


Sharing your voice would be a big help in shaping what we could do with this to make America #FeelTheBern!
results.how_to_find_us: I guess meet at the Dolphins then walk to find a place to sit from there!
results.name: Introduction, Plan Out Our Aims!

group.name: Staten Island, NYC for Bernie Sanders

results.description:
Assalaamu 'alaykum Wa Rahmatullahi Wa Barakatuhu,

I pray to Allah that this email reaches you while you are in the highest status of Iman and happiness and enjoying the blessings of health and peace of mind.The  Hadra (zikr) starts at 5:30PM Insha Allah which is follow by a light snack Insha Allah and lesson.  See you at the dhikr insha Allah.

***Please email us if you are coming for the first time so we can open the lobby door.***
results.name: Weekly Hadra (Meditation) and learn about Islam and Sufism

results.description: This is a monthly Reiki Share in the style of the share held at Daizen-in Temple in Kyoto, Japan by Reiki Master Hyakuten Inamoto. A Reiki "Share" is just that, people sharing Reiki, and it is open to anyone even if you have never tried Reiki before! So, if you're new to Reiki this is a great chance to try it! Everyone will receive group-style Reiki where one person at a time will lie on the table while the others give Reiki. And a basic Reiju (Attunement) will be given to all who attend. Cost: $25
results.name: Monthly Reiki Share with Jyogan

Please join several dozen professionals for the weekly Sunday 5:30 Contemporary Mass at Holy Trinity Church conveniently located on the upper west side of Manhattan!  This mass is a great way to top off your week with relationship building with God and your peers.

Holy Trinity Church

213 West 82nd Street

Between Amsterdam and Broadway

Every Sunday after mass we gather in front of church for some socializing before heading over to a pre decided venue.  Why not become part of a growing, warm, welcoming and cohesive community!

venue.name: The Cabana Yacht

results.description:
This may be our last cruise of the Summer so don't miss it!

Mix, mingle, drink & dance the night away with a panoramic view of the NYC skyline, Statue Of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower etc. on a 100 ft, 2-deck private yacht.   

Join 200+ singles (ages 21-49) from 20+ Meetup groups and set sail around Manhattan for a four hour tour & party!   

*All our cruises sell out so please get your ticket ASAP.  

*1st 5 members save $5 w/ discount code "5" at checkout ($20) https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

What's included: 

• Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

*$20 w/ discount code "5", price goes up to $50 as event gets closer. MUST PREPAY HERE (No tix sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

Video from past cruises: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LViOu6VHBY

 • The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is air conditioned and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 5:45pm.  The boat takes off 6pm sharp and returns at 10pm.  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  It is a 21 and older event.

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  20+ groups are co-organizing and 200+ will be attending. Prepay Only Event - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

Pics from past cruises -
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
This may be our last cruise of the Summer so don't miss it!

Mix, mingle, drink & dance the night away with a panoramic view of the NYC skyline, Statue Of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower etc. on a 100 ft, 2-deck private yacht.   

Join 200+ singles (ages 21-49) from 20+ Meetup groups and set sail around Manhattan for a four hour tour & party!   

*All our cruises sell out so please get your ticket ASAP.  

*1st 5 members save $5 w/ discount code "5" at checkout ($20) https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

What's included: 

• Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

*$20 w/ discount code "5", price goes up to $50 as event gets closer. MUST PREPAY HERE (No tix sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

Video from past cruises: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LViOu6VHBY

 • The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is air conditioned and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 5:45pm.  The boat takes off 6pm sharp and returns at 10pm.  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  It is a 21 and older event.

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  20+ groups are co-organizing and 200+ will be attending. Prepay Only Event - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

results.description:
Party at sunset and under the stars with an incredible view of the Midtown Manhattan skyline at LIC Landing, one of NYC’s most spectacular venues - where elegance meets nightlife. 

We're taking the word “party” to a whole new level by moving the club outdoors! Think music festival on the waterfront, under the stars with the most amazing view of NYC.   

You will receive special wireless headphones that will allow you to choose from 3 top DJs spinning on one main stage – with some amazing surprises and giveaways too!

Prepay Only Event for this group. Ticket prices start at $15 and will go up to $25 as event gets closer. GET TIX HERE -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/sundayfunday/

Not only will you have 3 different types of music to dance to, you’ll also have the chance to enjoy a spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline and party at sunset – what better way to end the weekend? 

Delicious Drinks & Amazing Food available for purchase. LIC Landing is a brand-new waterfront park, next to the East River Ferry terminal. 18+ to party, 21+ to Drink. Rain or Shine Event. 

GET TICKETS HERE (Prepay Only Event) -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/sundayfunday/

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 100+ members attending.

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - NYC

results.description:
We tend to think of ourselves as being greater than the sum of our parts but is there a verifiable basis for such belief?  Let us explore the idea of consciousness permanence, this pretty notion that the consciousness is ever-lasting aspect of existence which defines identity and personality.  Prepare to have your pre-conceptions of consciousness challenged.

We will expound on the ideas postulated by psychologist Julian Jaynes in his "The Origin of Consciousness in the Breakdown of the Bicameral Mind" and other works.  Essentially, Jaynes proposes that consciousness as we know it today is a recent emergence due to a breakdown of bicameralism--independent functioning of brain hemispheres (they are currently connected by a 'bridge' called corpus callosum).  Under stress, activation of the directive hemisphere resulted in auditory instructions and the compliant hemisphere would then ensure that such instructions are carried out to ensure survival.  Today's mental health problems such as Alzheimer's or Bipolar Disorder, according to Jaynes, are remnants of what was once a perfectly normal way of functioning.  The development of consciousness then assisted humankind in handling the increasingly complex structure of human society by providing an analog of the external world.  

Argo tea is a tea version of Starbucks, except with larger and more creative seating arrangement.  A wide range of teas and some snacks are available.  The space is nice and comfortable with AC.  It's not too loud and the atmosphere is conducive to lively discussion.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me!
results.name: Let's find the source of consciousness

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Manny D.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: CANCELED- Sunday 5:45pm Soccer @ Riverside (7v7) for PS2G

Join 200+ singles (ages 21-49) from 20+ Meetup groups and set sail around Manhattan for a four hour tour & party!   

*All our cruises sell out so please get your ticket ASAP.  

*1st 5 members save $5 w/ discount code "5" at checkout ($20) https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

What's included: 

• Light Appetizers

• DJ

• Ice Breakers

• Cash bar

• Prizes

*$20 w/ discount code "5", price goes up to $50 as event gets closer. MUST PREPAY HERE (No tix sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

Video from past cruises: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LViOu6VHBY

 • The boat will sail rain or shine! The boat has two levels. The main level is air conditioned and enclosed and there is an outside deck on the second level. 

• Boarding begins at 5:45pm.  The boat takes off 6pm sharp and returns at 10pm.  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual".  It is a 21 and older event.

• You must get your ticket in advance.  RSVPing without pre-payment will not get you into the event.  We're expecting a sell out. Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• The # of RSVP’s reflect only a portion of those attending.  20+ groups are co-organizing and 200+ will be attending. Prepay Only Event - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yacht/dates/Aug-23-2015_at_0600PM

results.description:
FREE Quiet Clubbing Party at Plaza33. Join us for a Sunday evening party at Plaza33! This outdoor venue in Midtown Manhattan is perfect for a night of music, dance, and food. The best part? It’s FREE.

There will be three different music channels to dance to – 3 DJs spinning live! With your headset, you’ll be able to switch from hip hop/R&B, Top 40s, and throwback tunes. The party kicks off at 6pm and all ages are welcome.

The dance venue is adjacent to Penn Plates, New York’s new pop-up food market, where you can enjoy food from Black Iron Burger, Melt Bakery, Mason Jar, Taco Bono, and more. Be there or be square!

Must register for free ticket at https://quietevents.com/events/free-quiet-clubbing-party-at-plaza33/
results.name: Free Quiet Clubbing Party

group.name: FREE or inexpensive things to do in New York City

results.description:
Join us aboard the 100-foot, two-level party yacht The Cabana, as we cruise around Manhattan, take a look at amazing views of the NYC skyline, statue of liberty, and more! Over 200 singles ages 20s, 30s, and early 40s will be in attendance, and DJ will be spinnin' dance music of the past-present. We’ll have complimentary appetizers, fun ice breakers, prizes, and two levels & two cash bars. Love will be in the air and drinks will be flowing...

Recommended ages: Females 21-45, Males 23-45

Tickets are only $20 each with RSVP, or $50 at door without RSVP


Note, this is not a Russian-only event, but we have a large Russian  following so you can expect to see lots of Russian singles in attendance.

results.description:
The Museum of Interesting Things
takes over a Soho loft for a special

Victrola - a - Go Go!!!
You get to DJ also!

WE ARE ON THE 6th Floor this time with the rooftop garden!  woohoo!

16mm short movies & music fest & party!
Drinks, music, food & beautiful visuals!

In the spirit of a true Speakeasy
Anything can change so...
Please check this website before leaving.

http://www.secretspeakeasy.com/

We will have nearly all our cool music players
Victrolas, Edison cylinder players, Mikiphone
the famous Mighty Tiny! 8 Track karaoke players
I will demo and dj them all and ... so will YOU!
Wait till you see the amazing selection of records!
in aaall formats!

There will also be a talk by the director of the
audio history library and museum
as well as some music performances, 
from performers from a Times Square Musical and
Aunt Ange wild show and maybe me!

You are part of a select few receiving this website.
Please only spread to people you know and love!
Yes, the rumors are true, we are shooting part of
a pilot for a possible show at the gig. smile ;)

All eras of history some over 100 years old!
See Old 16mm circus, animations, vaudville and more

The Museum has a show featuring
Original Rare short 16mm films from the
1940’s, 1950’s and 1960's
and you get to pick the films allll night!

Also, there will be an early event you can go to: 
A masonic lecture at 4pm
by The 19th Century Society 
Freemasonry in 19th Century New York:
A True Story of Murder and Resurrection.
There is separate ticketing for that 
And those tickets will also get you into the speakeasy!
Click here for details and ticketing

and many more 16mm as well as a few 8mm films too! 

Early 1900’s and some 1800’s
Stereoviews and Mutoscope cards!


The Loft at Prince Street 177 Prince Street
6th Floor! $10 to help the museum :)
Between Thompson & Sullivan street
in Soho NYC[masked]

Advance Tickets:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/secret-speakeasy-victrola-a-go-go-tickets-17963564505
results.how_to_find_us: Between Thompson & Sullivan Streets WE ARE ON THE 6th Floor this time

results.description:
Let's take our practice outside this Sunday in Fort Lee Historic Park!  Our lovely scenic lawn is waiting for us! Bring your mat or a beach towel and some water if the weather is hot.  I can bring some extra mats if you let me know in advance. Also, if you need a ride from Shala Zeni, message me or let me know in the comments and be at the Shala at 5:40pm please (if I don't hear specifically, I'll assume you are meeting us at the park). 

We'll meet at 6PM at the Fort Lee Historic Park parking lot and will walk from there to a hidden lawn at the Southern-most point of the park with scenic overlook of the GW bridge, Manhattan skyline & Edgewater marina.  

DIRECTIONS (by car, walking, bike or public transportation): CLICK HERE or see picture below.  Meeting point is at the top of the ramp inside the park (where the star is on the picture).  

Pricing: $10 per person.
results.name: Sunday Sunset Yoga in Fort Lee Historic Park (Outdoors)

results.description: Hi tennis lovers! Let's play some tennis at nights when the sun is going to sleep and we are still awake!:P
results.name: Tennis Is ON!-In Honor Of Tony Busse Providing Us These Wonderful Opportunities!

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 30-42 - 2M/1F SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
Please note this restaurant is CASH ONLY.


The Place: The only steak house in New York with a Michelin star, this is an old school place where waiters serve aged beef in a German beer hall setting.

Peter Luger has been named the best steakhouse in New York City by Zagat Survey for 30 years in a row.The Brooklyn location is known for its long wooden bar, and the "dining rooms have a Teutonic air, with exposed wooden beams, burnished oak wainscoting, brass chandeliers and weathered beer-hall tables."

In 2002, it was named to the James Beard Foundation's list of "America's Classics."

Menu is here:

http://peterluger.com/brooklyn-menu/

As always:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Peter Luger's - Steakhouse

results.description:
Each week dozens of CRC members and friends gather following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity to socialize, network and connect.  It is a great way to meet others in the group in a fun and casual way.

This week we will be going to Firehouse Tavern who has donated to our charity events in the past.  Hang out at the bar and socialize or sit and have a bite to eat with the group, separate checks are no problem. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, Sunday is the best time to come on your own as almost everyone comes on their own.  Dave will be on hand to welcome everyone old and new.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity Parish? No many of our members belong to other parishes.

What if I went to the earlier mass?  Not a problem, come for the gathering and enjoy food and drink

The group will meet on the sidewalk after mass (approx 6:30pm) then walk over together or you can meet us at the restaurant.

Amy  is the host for this Sunday.
results.name: After Mass Gathering at Firehouse Tavern

group.name: Holy Trinity Church - Contemporary Roman Catholics  NYC

results.description:
LOGLINE: Based on the true story of the world's first wing walker, three generations of the Locklear family struggle to be taken seriously by a world that has relegated them to sideshows, servants and minors without a voice. (Family, Historical Drama)

NOTE: This is a Feature Film script even though the meeting is on a Sunday.

ABOUT THE SCREENWRITERS: Joe Collevecchio is a human male.  Joe is a screenwriter and editor who specializes in crime and historical drama.  He is drawn to complex characters placed in moral grey areas and to the influence the land itself plays in dramatic events. His scripts explore the complex relationship between motivation and action, why good people do awful things, and how evil or wrong action is a matter of perspective. Joe studied Journalism at UNC Chapel Hill and also works in advertising as a copywriter and video producer.

Kat Croft is a producer and artist who recently finished her first feature-length screenplay with writing partner Joe Collevecchio. Kat launched her career in film working in the Art Departments of award-winning films – HBO's “Iron-Jawed Angels” (2004), Columbia/TriStar's “The Color of Love” (2002), MGM’s “New Best Friend” (2002) and the WB series –“Dawson's Creek” (1998). Kat is also known for her campaign work with Participant Media for the controversial documentary “Waiting for ‘Superman’” (2010) and also built a digital presence for award-winning documentaries “Shakespeare High” (2011) and “Made in L.A.” (2007).


AGENDA

• Review the Script

• Talk about The Craft / The Business. 

To Do 

• Download the SCRIPT from our "FILES" section the week before our meeting. Read it and come prepared to give your constructive commentary.

• Members who bring written reviews go first. :)

• If you sign up after the PASSWORD email blast (1 week before meeting) then email/message [masked] for the password.


• Please do not distribute passwords, scripts, or materials you obtain from RSVPing to Collective workshops.

Thanks and see you soon!
results.name: "SAFETY SECOND"-FEATURE MTNG-by Joe Collevecchio, Kat Croft (Historical Drama)

results.description:
This is an announcement from the Bay Area Community Land Trust. Your RSVP on this meetup is just to indicate that you are attending, but you need to RSVP directly to [masked] to get the address. You need to attend the open house to get an application.

Affordable room for rent in South Berkeley cooperative house!
You are invited to an Open House on Sunday August 23 at 7:00 PM!

Brown Shingle Mutual Housing is an affordable housing community owned by Bay Area Community Land Trust. Brown Shingle is located in the South Campus neighborhood of Berkeley and consists of three large, brown shingle houses. One room is available September 15 or later, in a cooperative house, shared with three other roommates. Rent is $500 a month and a $1,000 security deposit is required. No Pets and No Off-street Parking. This property is currently rental housing, and is in the process of becoming resident-managed. All tenants must commit to participating in workshops to learn skills for managing the property; you will need to be available to devote 8-10 hours a month for training, maintenance tasks and meetings related to the property. Applicant’s income must be below 80% of area median income. Applicant must provide proof that income is 80% of Area Median Income or below. This means that for a single person, your annual pre-tax income must be $50,150 or less.

The house is large, with lots of common space, and the room for rent is a large room on the third floor. The roommates currently are two men and one woman, and all genders are welcome and encouraged to apply. One roommate is woman who works as a linguist and language teacher, loves travel, swimming, yoga. She raised her daughter here as part of the household. Her daughter is now grown and recently moved out on her own. Another roommate is a gay man, recently retired from Berkeley Unified School District, enjoys living communally, loves cooking and travel, appreciates a good sense of humor and a warm and harmonious living space. The third roommate is originally from Venezuela, his current career is in programming websites and database applications. He has two teenage kids who visit the house regularly. He enjoys gardening, biking, organic food, and sports. You are invited to an Open House to see the house and the room, on Sunday August 23 at 7:00 PM! The open house will be for one hour only, so please try to get there on time. Please RSVP to Brown Shingle [masked] , we will provide the address for the open house to everyone that RSVP’s.
results.name: Open House - Berkeley Cooperative House

group.name: People of Color Sustainable Housing Network

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! -Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

 

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Sunday Evening at Heights Meditation is a great way to end or begin your week with others similarly-minded:  those seeking clarity of mind and open-heartedness in their everyday lives.

The Sunday evening meeting normally begins with some chant as a means to center the self and lighten up. We like to think of it as a kind of spiritual singalong, and who doesn't like a singalong? We use several easy-to-learn and different Sanskrit texts and leave it to members to choose a chant they'd like the group to use on a particular evening. If you have never chanted before, come along and try out this wonderful spiritual tool. It doesn't matter if it seems strange to you--the point is precisely to buck oneself out of a sense of 'ordinary' life--or if you think you are completely atonal. You will probably derive a lot of benefit from doing chant, and it can lastingly help you forward in life.

After the chanting ends, we immediately go into silent meditation for 20-25 minutes. Whereas chant tends to focus and energize the body and mind, silent meditation tends to quiet and calm the mind. It's a perfect counterpoint to the chanting.

As you can see, then, the Sunday evening meetings are a kind of dual spiritual exercise: of energizing and focusing the mind (chant) and then relaxing and calming it (meditation).

Come along to this or our other meetings if you feel you'd like to live a happier, calmer life and be able to live fearlessly through the cares and worries of modern life. If you can find a way to slow down and live more mindfully, you are well on the way to being an agent of joy and serenity in your own life and the lives of those living around you.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group

results.description:
Summer is coming to a close and I just got word I have the next week off - so while this is somewhat of a departure for this group it sounds like a fun day. Free and open to the public. Maybe some blini at Brighton afterward. Join us in Coney Island for a perfect summer afternoon for the whole family. Warm up with a dance lesson and then try out your new moves as our DJs deliver great tracks spanning disco, top 40, golden oldies, and classic R&B straight to your headphones.

Headphones are free, but you’ll need a credit card or ID to borrow them. Bags are not allowed on the dance floor, so leave them at home.

1:00 Doors Open
1:30 Dance Lesson
2:30-5:00 Silent Dance Party
Style: Disco, beach music
Dance Instructor: Helen Pontani of the World Famous Pontani Sisters teaches beach blanket dance party moves
DJ: Bill Coleman, Connie T. Empress

Silent Disco Powered by Quiet Events

The Beach at Coney Island
The Boardwalk between West 10th Street and West 12th Street
Closest subways: F, Q at W. 8th St – NY Aquarium; F, Q, D, N at Coney Island – Stillwell Avenue
results.name: Silent Disco - Coney Island

results.description:
Join us as we welcome photographer Bryon Summers to Adorama.  He will take you through the process to understand the importance of a smooth workflow. We shoot every day but how do we go from taking a photograph to the finished print or digital file? What do you prefer to edit with and is it cheating to use presets? In this session we will discuss the editing process and what makes an image good for printing vs digital submissions.


Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/BryonSummers_HEAD.jpg?itok=TYyfLUAT

Bryon Summers is the resident photographer for the number one hip-hop podcast, The Combat Jack Show and host of his own weekly photography based podcast, We're Getting Better. 

In 2013, Summers moved to New York to work for an ambitious media company. While there he wore several hats serving as an Associate Producer, Director of Photography, and Creative Services Producer he helped create daily content as well as over 10 documentaries. Outside of the 9-5 grind Summers shot personal photography projects that eventually lead to exhibitions in New York and New Jersey.

Summers took the stage at a CreativeMornings New York event and was bitten by the speaking bug. Since then he has used his experiences in and out of media as topics to share with audiences aspiring to progress in their respective fields. In addition to creating We’re Getting Better, Summers has held educational workshops at universities.  

Bryon is a Maryland native and Brooklyn resident. Find more workat BryonSummers.com and Instagram @BryonSummers.
results.name: SEMINAR: Editing. Digital vs Print with Bryon Summers

results.description:
This event is a FREE!

Located at the Rock n Joe in Union NJ. Come play melee and hang out with chill people from all over Central / North NJ.

Please bring your own controller and if you have any CRTS + gamecubes + power strips / extension cords please bring those as well. 

We want to avoid the dreaded 5 man rotations!

--Venue--

Literally inside Union train station which is serviced by the Raritan Valley NJ Transit Line!

We will also plan for some tournaments in the future with prizes.

results.description:
The U.S. Department of Energy Solar Decathlon challenges collegiate teams to design, build, and operate solar-powered houses that are affordable, energy-efficient, and attractive.

We have been invited to tour the decathalon entry from City Tech which is being built in the Brooklyn Navy Yard. 

This is a great opportunity to learn about cutting-edge materials and technology. 

Does anyone know of a fun place nearby where we could meet up and go into the Navy Yard as a group?

results.name: Tour City Tech's Solar Decathalon Project in the Brooklyn Navy Yard!

results.description:
Hi Moms!

My name is Mariann and I am an UES mom and photographer who specializes in children and family portraits.

I am doing a short promo video in Central Park that will show me photographing kids and families.

I am looking for one mom to be (ideally 6-7 months pregnant), one family of 3-5 and a couple toddlers 12 months and older.

The shoot is scheduled for August 24th, Monday in the afternoon in Central Park. (Rain date is August 26th, Wednesday, afternoon.)

Each "model"/family gets to be photographed for about 15-20 minutes and will receive 5-10 complementary high resolution images files (jpegs).

Please check out my website to see my photography style at http://bluedaisykids.com and send me an email if you are interested.
In the e-mail please state you name and phone number and the age of the children and if you have any time preference.
(We'll try to accommodate as much as possible.)
Also, if you have a recent photo/headshot of your family/kids/etc please include that as well.

You can e-mail me at [masked] and will send you more information.

Thank you so much!!

Mariann

Blue Daisy Kids
bluedaisykids.com
bluedaisyblog.com
[masked]

results.description:
The 645Z is one of the most talked about medium format cameras out there. And with good reason: The 645Z boasts incredible features such as full HD, 51 mega pixels, a weather sealed body and so much more.  This camera is designed for the seasoned photographer or hobbyist craving stunning image quality. Sports, portrait, commercial and action shooters agree that the images printed from this machine are anything less than magnificent.  Come and experience the Pentax 645Z for yourself at our open house. You will see why pro shooters just love this camera. Pentax Image Maker Chris Knight will be available to show you how to get the most out of this camera and answer all your questions.  Attendees will be able to participate in a live model shoot using the Pentax 645Z and ProFoto lighting and are encouraged to bring their own SD memory cards to do so. 

Click here to see the Pentax 645Z. For all that Pentax has to offer, click here.

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/ChrisKnight_HEAD_0.jpg?itok=BJhyajvC Chris Knight was born in Wiesbaden, Germany and hardened by the sweaty, nearly chewable, humidity of Florida. He combines his unconditional love of art history with his love of technology, topping it off with a flare for the cinematic and an uncompromising eye for light and detail. His work has appeared in or on Vogue, People, MSNBC, ABC, Ocean Drive, GQ and others. Chris is an instructor at Pratt Institute as well as the New York Film Academy. He is a regular contributor to Fstoppers.
results.name: SEMINAR: Hands On Demonstration of the Pentax 645Z

results.description:
Hey guys,

It's summer time in NYC, my favourite time of the year! Let's go to Bryant Park, picnic on the lawn, socialize, make new friends and watch a classic movie together. I went there a couple of times last year and I love it!!! Personally, I think it is one of the must-have experience in the summer as a New Yorker!

I will try to get there earlier with my blanket to secure good spot. But if you get off work early and can help us get a spot, that would be lovely!

My cell# (718)[masked]

Description:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qvsgGtivCgs

Back to the Future

5:00pm | Lawn

presented by Bank of America

Michael J. Fox is a teen in 1985 who time travels to 1955 and gets caught up in the courtship of his then teenaged parents-to-be to save his own existence. Christopher Lloyd is the mad scientist who makes the impossible possible with a DeLorean. Directed by Robert Zemeckis with Huey Lewis' song The Power of Love Oscar-nominated. (1985) 116 min. (PG) Universal

HBO Bryant Park Summer Film Festival
presented by Bank of America
Classic films under the stars on the big screen. Bring a blanket and sit on the lawn to enjoy great food, friends, plus a classic Warner Brothers cartoon before each film.

The lawn opens at 5:00pm for blankets and picnicking. Films begin at sunset (typically between 8pm and 9pm).

All packages, bags, briefcases, backpacks, etc. subject to inspection.
results.name: Back To The Future - Summer Movie/Picnic in Bryant Park

We usually play in the back field (you have to go over a bridge to find the field) unless there's a kids game in process, if that happens, we will play in another field. Warm ups start after 5:30 pm and the game starts around 6:00pm.  Weather permitting!

results.description:
This easy-to-follow dance moves are designed to get your body moving and sweating the pounds away. The Zumba® classes are dynamic vertical core movements, red-hot midsection exercises and rockin' new music. Strengthening core muscles enhances balance and stability, and improves posture and alignment to help amp up your every move.


Perfect For anyone who is looking for a take Zumba® class that recreates the original moves you love.


How It Works
The design of the class introduces easy-to-follow Zumba® choreography that focuses on balance, core, range of motion and coordination. Come ready to sweat, and prepare to leave empowered and feeling strong.

Benefits
Class focuses on all elements of fitness: cardiovascular, muscular conditioning, flexibility, core and balance!

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

"Where we're going......we don't need roads."

Gasp! The year is 1955. Marty McFly and his red down vest have to get back to 1985 before he alters his family's fate as well as that of his hometown altogether! CAN HE DO IT???

Come spend a beautiful summer night with us outside as we watch the adventure unfold in this cult classic. French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

to throw the cards,  learn lots, and make new friends!

Warmly, 

Ferol

results.description:
As new sources and strategies for data collection and analysis become available to the architectural profession, data-driven practices and methods are paramount to shaping the next generation of design. Leading data evangelists and design experts will identify, discuss, and share ideas on the tools and techniques integral to the success of a project’s data life cycle, from conception to production to post-occupancy. Our first panel explored how and why data must be used to design, measure, and learn from buildings and occupants to improve the architectural product. Now, some of NYC’s best and brightest will show you how to better leverage data within your own practice to improve and iterate on the design and performance of your work. Our panel will focus closely on human, social and urban data sets.

The increasing amount of data available to architects and designers represents an exciting opportunity to improve projects and profits, from work processes and client relationships to document management and strategic collaboration. With the pressure on architects to differentiate their business with faster, cheaper, and more valuable services in an ever-expanding data ecosystem, the critical moment is now; leverage the skills and tools of our profession to shape the next-generation of data-driven design.

</a>

<a href="http://www.urbandatadesign.org/about/">Shawn Rickenbacker, Co- Founder, URBAN DATA + DESIGN (UDD), is managing partner and principal research and design consultant.  Shawn holds a Master of Architecture Degree from the University of Virginia with a Certificate in American Urbanism.  He has over 15 years of design field experience, having practiced architecture, product design and also as a curator of art and exhibitions.  He has taught systemic design approaches at both international and national universities.  His dossier of extensive world travel and a love of systems has forged his creative insight and problem solving skills. His work and design research has been exhibited and published, and has received numerous awards. Shawn is also a faculty member at the University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Design where he teaches data driven design, allowing him to put into practice that which he preaches.

Zak Kostura is a Structural Engineer in ARUP’s New York office, with particular expertise in high performance structures. He has been a part of the project team for the Fulton Center project for more than ten years, on which he served as lead structural designer for Sky Reflector-Net, an eight-story tensile structure that serves as the centerpiece for the project. His design contributions on the project also extend to computational analysis of the historic cast iron tunnel structures of the New York City Subway within the Fulton Center complex, and design of structural modifications to enhance connectivity within the transit system. 
In addition to work on the Fulton Street Transit Center, Zak has worked on a broad array of other projects, including tall and supertall buildings in the Middle East and Asia, sculptures and other artistic installations, airports, railway stations and underground structures. In his work, Zak emphasizes the importance of modern computational tools and techniques in an efficient process that yields the greatest value for clients.  Zak is also an adjunct assistant professor of architecture in the Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation at Columbia University, where he provides a focus on structurally expressive architecture. He is also co-instructor of a materials-based advanced design studio.

Darrick Borowski is a designer, futurist and expat of the Midwest, with over 17 years’ experience working on architecture, design and branding projects worldwide from offices in New York, London, Seattle and Chicago. He is Principal and Design Director at ARExA, an architectural practice advancing new modes of living, working and growing in an increasingly urbanizing world. Each project is seen as an opportunity for research through design and vice-versa, with an interest in our relationship with design and its effects on us and our behavior. Previously, as Creative Director at JPDA he led teams in retail, entertainment and interactive experience design for top tier clients including Apple, American Apparel, Harley Davidson and O2. As co-founder of the research collaborative Edible Infrastructures, Darrick lectures and publishes about his research employing algorithmic design tools to speculate on new generative mechanisms for the design of future cities. Darrick teaches 2nd year design studio at the School of Visual Arts Interior Design program. The studio's focus is on research methodologies in design practice.

Jeff Ferzoco, Founder of Linepointpath, has more than a decade of experience in information design, and specializes in new ways to visually explore the data in urban spaces. His practice meets at the crossroads of information, interactivity and urban planning — resulting in new ways to collect, display and use place-oriented data, or just have fun with it. His mapping projects have been featured in Fast Company, the New York Times, Atlantic Cities, and used in cities across the world.

Moderator:

Melissa Marsh is Founder and CEO of PLASTARC, a social research, workplace innovation, and real estate strategy firm dedicated to shifting the metrics associated with workplace from 'square feet and inches', to 'occupant satisfaction and performance.' PLASTARC is a  portmanteau of plastic and architecture, representing a focus on engaging architecture to be more flexible, dynamic, and fun through social research and analytics. An active contributor to many professional communities, Melissa curates the AIANY Transforming Architectural Practice series which explores emerging topics in the management of business in the A&E industry, such as technology, strategic differentiation and intellectual property.
results.name: DATA-DRIVEN DESIGN 2.0

results.description:
NYPH is happy to share this event organized by the AIANY Building Enclosure Council (BEC) and presented by the local Solar Decathlon teams: 

- New York City College of Technology - DURAhome
- Stevens Institute of Technology - SURE HOUSE

August 24, 2015 

6:00 PM - 8:00 PM
At The AIANY Center (536 LaGuardia Place)

1.5 LU | 1.5 HSW AIA Credits Will Be Offered to Attendees


Please register here


Energy Efficiency and Disaster Resiliency are the themes for the local Solar Decathlon teams, New York City College of Techonolgy's DURAhome and Stevens Institute's SURE HOUSE.


These ambitious students will be competing against 15 other college teams in Irvine, CA this fall. For this competition, they have added a local twist: disaster resiliency. Both teams have added innovative technology to make both energy efficient and a disaster resilient buildings.

As part of the competition, each team has independently designed and financed their entry, which they expect be both NetZero and to meet Passive House standards. Come get a sneak peek of their innovative designs and let’s send them off with a rousing cheer!

The U.S. Department of Energy Solar Decathlon, held biennially, challenges collegiate teams to design, build, and operate solar-powered houses that are cost-effective, energy-efficient, and attractive. The winner of the competition is the team that best blends affordability, consumer appeal, and design excellence with optimal energy production and maximum efficiency.

Team project managers and student representatives will present each project.

Moderator: Chris Benedict, Principal, Chris Benedict, RA

Chris Benedict is a pioneer and fearless advocate of energy efficient building design in NYC, completing her first high-performance multifamily project in 1998. Her technical knowledge, ability to innovate, perseverance, and attention to detail have challenged industry preconceptions and raised the bar on what is possible. An architect, teacher and active industry leader, Benedict prides herself in the design of beautiful, energy efficient, healthy apartment buildings built for the same price as typical construction.

Organized by: AIANY Building Enclosure Council 


Price: Free for AIA members and Students with valid ID; $10 for non-AIA members 

Please register here
results.name: 2015 Solar Decathlon: Energy Efficiency and Disaster Resilency

As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising. 

Enter “The Nakamoto Circle of All Satoshi Squares” aka the World’s Largest Direct Sellers-to-Buyers Bitcoin Trading Pit! 

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups, as we are an incubator for these. Gaze upon MiningBot and Cash2BTC, two examples of path-breaking Bitcoin hardware the center co-developed. Meet or become a center sponsor and get exposure among the right audience and media!

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Monday & Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play. 
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
