results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

BNI Dream Team As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, August 11th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

Plenty of Parking, trains: M & R, Grand Ave station

The cost is $15 which includes breakfast.

Please bring 30 business cards to pass out.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

results.description:
Healthcharge NYC is holding a meditation class in Union Square (see specific location below) led by Jess. The class is open to anyone, but will be an introductory class for people with no or some experience with meditation.

Our indoor space will enable you to meditate without needing you to change clothes, cross legs or lie down. As an introductory class, know that having your mind wander is normal and not something to worry about -- Jess is there to guide you through the process.

We will accept donations but more than anything, we will be most grateful if you complete a five-question survey about your experience after the session.


Class Outline

1. 8:00-8:10 am - overview of meditation

2. 8:10-8:25 am - guided meditation

3. 8:25-8:30 am - closing thoughts + Q&A


Where to Meet

Darrow's Farm Fresh, 115 E 18th St, New York, NY


What to Bring

Bring yourself as you are, we expect most attendees to go to work directly after our session and your work clothes are wonderful. We will be sitting in chairs for this meditation session. 


About Your Guide

Jess Geevarghese is a meditation and RYT-500 certified yoga instructor who works with private individuals and organizational clients. She loves to empower people with the ability to bring awareness to the breath and to the mind, an underutilized, but extremely powerful tool for well-being. She has presented on this topic/meditation as a stress management tool and led numerous meditations in the NY metro area, particularly for health care professionals at risk of burnout.  She holds an BSBA, MBA and MSW from Washington University in St. Louis. 

Questions?

Post comments or send us a Meetup message!

results.description:
How does a TennisNewYork Season / League run?

The league advertises the season dates and builds a queue of committed players for the season.

Kickoff Day - Aug. 25th

The start day of the season, players are sent a kickoff email that contains important information about the league, the link where your league standings and players contact information. We guarantee 6 playing partners at your playing level, but have been averaging closer to 15+ partners in most cities.

Your Task - "Flexible Scheduling"

After this kickoff email is sent, it is the player's task to communicate with other players. Players should work with their partners to find an agreeable time and location to play the match. While TennisNewYork doesn't mandate your playing schedule, it is recommended that players schedule at least one match per week. By request of the players, we started to allow players to play 1 rematch per season. The regular season is all about playing as much as you can. As of Jan. 1st, 2013 we've had 189 players play more than 20 matches in a season.


Special Note for NYC tennis players: We don't have any special privileges to use the courts throughout New York City. You do need to follow by the rules provided by the Parks Department. How to reserve tennis courts in NYC: NYC Park & Rec.

Where to Play?

Play at your local free tennis courts, tennis parks, condo courts or tennis clubs. The league strongly suggests that players jointly try to pick a tennis court location convenient to both. We provide an extensive list of tennis courts, including # of courts, lighting, hitting walls, etc. We strive to keep this list up-to-date.

How to Play?

Players can use three semi-standard playing formats: 2 out of 3 sets, 2 sets with 10 point super tie-breaker or the 10-game pro set (First to 10, used when court time is limited).

Playoffs

Each season concludes with a playoffs where players with anywhere from 3 to 5 season wins qualifies for a single elimination tourney. The champion is awarded based upon the league Prize Pool. Each singles league champion also receives a playing entry into the National Tourney which is already scheduled for Crandon Park Tennis Center in Key Biscayne - Nov. 13-15, 2015.

Join Today!!

Full price is $34.95 to play in a season, BUT the earlier you sign up we typically offer discounts during these tougher economic times. Just go to the Join Page and complete the short form. We'd be happy to find you dedicated tennis playing partners.
results.name: Fall Flex Season

results.description:
The streets of Lower Manhattan are alive in history and in daily activity. What began as a small trading outpost has grown to house institutions like the New York Stock Exchange and the World Trade Center. On this tour you experience the most historical site in all of the United States and others of immeasurable historical significance. The information presented will unveil new realities and perceptions that typically lay unseen.

Itinerary:
• Alexander Hamilton U.S Customs House
• Wall Street Bull
• Trinity Church
• New York Stock Exchange
• Federal Hall
• World Trade Center
• St. Paul’s Chapel
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:

Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the National Museum of the American Indian at 1 Bowling Green) map here. Tour concludes at City Hall Park map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

results.description:
Keenan D. Williams, Co-Founder & CEO, will present to Byte Academy students and community members on his FinTech start-up YDC Inc, which develops online marketplaces for Residential and Commercial real estate mortgage lending. Both platforms REZI.co (residential loans) and YourDealClosed.com (commercial loans) are enhanced with applications that expedite the process of securing debt financing for real estate deals through algorithmic automation and digitized documents thus, reducing laborious manual tasks and numerous human interactions that exist when procuring mortgage loans today. 

Mr. Williams will discuss the applications behind his product, start-up and tech scene, particularly in New York City. He will also describe his transition from non tech background in the real estate industry into the CEO of a FinTech company. Please see below for more information on YDC Inc,. Spaces will be limited for this event. 

YDC Inc,

YDC's first beta product, expected to be released in Q4 '15, Rezi.co, is a version of the new banking model- an online platform that educates consumers on home loans and originates residential mortgages for Single Family and 1-4 Family residences. In the Q4 '16 YDC plans to release its second beta product, YourDealClosed.com, commercial real estate enterprise software containing applications for Mortgage Brokers and CRE Lenders that will expedite the loan origination process by providing tools that enable lenders to make funding decisions faster.

Join us as we welcome Lucia Rollow as she will be talking about her personal path to photography, how that led to her darkroom, the growth of her darkroom, and what they currently offer or will be offering in the near future. 

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

</a>

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/LuciaRollow_HEAD.jpg?itok=a_dayFFp Lucia Rollow is a New England born artist, activist, and community organizer. In 2005 she moved to New York to pursue Photography at the School of Visual Arts. Upon completion of her bachelor’s degree, Rollow founded the <a href="http://www.bushwickcommunitydarkroom.com/about-us/">Bushwick Community Darkroom with the goal of providing an affordable space for local artists to create their work and connect with other like-minded creatives.  Rollow’s photography attempt to illustrate the global issues we face as a society in a direct, digestible, and comprehensive manner. She is most interested in the intersection of Capitalism, feminism and environmentalism, as well as their respective impacts on one another. 

You can also check out www.artsinbushwick.org/ for more information.

Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

275 Malcom X Blvd. (aka Lenox Avenue )

OPEN TO ALL! NO PREVIOUS UNDERSTANDING OR KNOWLEDGE NEEDED & 

THANKS FOR TAKING THE TIME TO READ THIS!

Save the date! Bring your questions & thoughts. This month we will do our best to cover some of the security issues and hacker news of the day. We also will have a special guest (who will talk about their work).

#harlemcryptoparty

# I AM A PRO & WANT TO SPEAK, PRESENT, HELP OUT

security pros interested in helping out? volunteering? contact: 
geminiimatt[at}protonmail.com via secure email &/or otr 
pgp signature: 381A B2F[masked] B00C 467F 0B87 70AA[masked]

jabber otr: [masked]

# WHAT'S A CRYPTOPARTY ## ## ## ##  
Cryptoparty Harlem: 

Sorry no chips, dip, awesome music or drinks. Just food for your mind. Ever wonder how to stay private, safe, & secure in today's digital age? What is a cryptoparty anyway? A CryptoParty is free, public and fun. People bring their computers, mobile devices, and a willingness to learn! In the time of the event people will learn and teach how to use basic cryptography tools. Cryptoparties are decentralized global events that are organized to answer questions and instruct people on technology & privacy. Cryptoparties are always free to attend, public, commercially and politically non-aligned and absolutely against sexual harassment and discrimination.

There are no dumb questions, you do not need to know anything about this subject, nor do you even need to bring a computer or phone. However that will help you get the most of it. For more information see the global cryptoparty website:

</a><a href="http://www.cryptoparty.in/">http://www.cryptoparty.in/

# WHERE ## ## ## ##

Creative Workspace @ HBA 
@CreativeWrkspce 
The #Harlem co-working space located at 
275 Lenox Avenue (also known as Malcom X Blvd) 
NY,NY 
10027

"Power to the Creatives!"

* always free $

closest train 2/3 to 125th Street Station

short wallk from A/B/C/D/ 125th Street Station

ok walk from 4/5/6 125th Street Station

# WHEN ## ## ## ##

Tuesday, August 25th, 2015 @ 5:45pm (-9pm)

# WHY ## ## ## ##

This Summer there has been a large media focus on all these hacks and the capabilities of foreign hackers. Often this media coverage is without the context of the "full story" that most of the hacks were proof of concepts for conference talks at things like blackhat, defcon, USENIX WOOT, etc. 

We will look at these and have a security researcher available to talk about the work they do and their take on the summer and the blackhat conference. Also are co-organizers are coming back from defcon (@huertanix, @tommycollison) , ccc camp (@huertanix, @corcra), & working with black lives matter activist (@geminiimatt) 

and of course we will be available to answer, discuss, teach, and learn about secure mobile use, secure browsing (using tor), secure email (using gpg), and secure chat (using otr). 

# BUT WHY HARLEM?! ## ## ##

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDq-OzMWQwg

 A lot of people don't know that back in December of 2013 NYC lauched The Harlem WiFi network (</a><a href="http://harlemfreewifi.com/">http://harlemfreewifi.com/) rolled out by Sky-Packets ( </a><a href="http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/">http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/ ) it extends 95 city blocks, from 110th to 138th Streets between Frederick Douglass Boulevard and Madison Avenue making it at the time the largest continuous free outdoor public wireless network in the nation. The internet is literally all around us and free in Harlem! So what better place to learn about using it safely.

@geminiimatt has lived in harlem for over a decade and has seen it change for the good & bad. However one thing that has stayed the same is the high level of surveillance & scrutiny faced by residents.  ONLINE: Please read Ben Popper's examination of the fallout from NYPD's Operation Crew Cut ,  "How the NYPD is using social media to put Harlem teens behind bars" (http://www.theverge.com/2014/12/10/7341077/nypd-harlem-crews-social-media-rikers-prison) , ON THE CORNER: Via official nypd cctv surveillance cameras & private owned cameras & FROM UP ABOVE: via SkyWatch tactical platform units and shotspotter (</a><a href="https://www.aclu.org/blog/free-future/shotspotter-ceo-answers-questions-gunshot-detectors-cities">https://www.aclu.org/blog/free-future/shotspotter-ceo-answers-questions-gunshot-detectors-cities), gunshot detection devices.

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

At Amplify, we maintain a very high level of quality for all our products across every team and stack. While doing so, we are constantly looking for new ways to use Open Source software to solve complex problems efficiently. Both Docker and Protractor have been hot topics of discussion in the software community in recent months. We will be sharing a few of our experiences with Docker & Protractor, so come join us at Amplify’s midtown office at 1155 Avenue of Americas.

Speakers:

Nicholas Christopher – Tech lead

Vincent Barresi – Sr. Software Engineer in Test

Sai Ongole – Software Engineer in Test

Charlye Tran – Software Engineer in Test

Vincent and Sai will be discussing how to utilize Docker Compose to spin up full test environments for automated testing. Nicholas will be discussing how to spin up Jenkins CI slaves using Docker. Charlye will be discussing Protractor framework design and maintenance across various teams, and best practices as well as test execution.

Note: Food and beverages will be served. Talk starts at 6:30 PM.

results.description:
OVERVIEW

Join us for an exciting session with another guest star: Cortana! She's the new digital assistant on Windows 10 and makes your computing more personal. More than that, as developers *you* can teach new tricks to Cortana and integrate her in your Windows 10 Universal apps. This is one of my most popular topics for what promises to be a super fun evening.

EVENING DETAILS

6:00PM - Doors open, head to the Radio City room on the 6th floor. Food will be served (Subway), courtesy of Microsoft.

6:30PM - Introduction by the host, housekeeping, sponsors,

6:45PM - Main presentation begins (see abstract below).

After the talk - Prize raffle courtesy of Microsoft, Telerik, O'Reilly Media, and other sponsors.

Your RSVP is required to add your name to the building security guest list. Please keep your RSVP up-to-date should you find yourself unable to come.

MAIN PRESENTATION

Building Windows 10 Universal Apps with Speech and Cortana

Can you hear me now? Move over Siri, Cortana is the new star in town and with her comes an army of speech-enabled mobile & desktop applications on Windows 10. Mobile applications are not always easy to work with due to the small screen and small on-screen keyboard. Using our voice is a natural form of communication amongst humans, and ever since 2001’s HAL9000 and Star Trek, we’ve been dreaming of computers who can converse with us like Tony Stark’s J.A.R.V.I.S. Or maybe you’re part of the new generation of Halo geeks dreaming of Cortana? Thanks to the new Windows 10 SDK for speech recognition and speech synthesis (aka text-to-speech), we are now several steps closer to this reality.

This session explores the development techniques you can use to add speech recognition to your Windows 10 applications, including in-app commands, standard & custom grammars, and voice commands usable outside of your app with Cortana. We’ll also see how your apps can respond to the user via speech synthesis, opening-up a new world of hands-free scenarios, and explore new features in Windows 10 like background voice commands and continuous dictation.

This reality is here, you’ll see actual live Windows 10 phone & desktop demos with speech and you can now learn how to do it. This session covers speech scenario on Windows 10 for Phone as well as Windows 10 apps running on tablets, laptops and desktops.

ABOUT THE PRESENTER

Nick Landry – Senior Technical Evangelist, Microsoft

Nick Landry (@ActiveNick) is a mobility pioneer and former entrepreneur specializing in cross-platform mobile app development for Windows, iOS and Android devices. Nick works at Microsoft as a Senior Technical Evangelist in the New York Metro area. He spent most his career in IT consulting, software and services companies across various technical and business roles, designing, building, managing and selling innovative software products and solutions for the world’s top brands and Fortune 500 companies.

Known for his dynamic and engaging style, he is a frequent speaker at major software development conferences worldwide, was a 10-year Microsoft MVP awarded on Windows Phone Development, and a Nokia Developer Ambassador & Champion. With over 23 years of professional experience, Nick is a certified developer and software architect by trade and specializes in Cross-Platform Mobility, GIS, Cloud, IoT and Mobile Game Development. He is an active blogger, occasional author, avid gamer, loving husband and proud father.

Blog: www.AgeofMobility.com

GitHub: https://github.com/activenick

LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/activenick

results.description:
Greetings! 

UPDATE

STSANY is offering another FREE Singing and Acting Workshop to new members, members who have never attended a workshop, and to others who may wish to become members. STSANY membership is FREE.

FYI: RSVP DEADLINE has been extended to Monday, August 24 at 10:00 p.m.

IMPORTANT: NO-SHOWS ARE UNACCEPTABLE!!! If you RSVP "yes" and have to cancel, please change your RSVP on the website by Monday, August. 24. Thank you.

To reserve a spot for Tuesday, August 25 from 6:00-8:00 p.m. , RSVP by Monday, August 24.. You will be given a 15-20 minute sample workshop of what you can expect in regularly scheduled workshops. This is on a first come, first served basis, so specific times will be assigned to those signing up.

* The workshop will include the following:

* Warm-up vocal exercises;

* Vocal evaluations to determine your level of study;

* Work on vocal technique designed for your individual voice, needs and experience;

* Coaching on vocal interpretation of songs and monologues;

* Advice on both vocal and dramatic repertoire appropriate for your training and experience.

SINGERS: Bring a song (complete sheet music with accompaniment) you  know well, if possible. If not, a song will be provided at the workshop.

ACTORS: Bring a 2-3 minute dramatic or comic monologue

NOTE: Additional free workshops may be given on Saturdays and week nights during the year -  TBA. Please check your emails for dates and times.

GET TO KNOW WHAT STSANY IS ALL ABOUT:  Check out past events, photos, and click on "more" to see uploaded programs of events, etc.

NOTE: TO read about STSANY's GOALS and reviews, click on pages: http://www.meetup.com/SOMETHING-TO-SING-ABOUT-IN-NEW-YORK/about/

To see and hear members perform, please VISIT and SUBSCRIBE TO our youtube channel by clicking on this link: https://www.youtube.com/user/AlmaMusica/videos?view_as=public

FYI: I also look forward to seeing and working with at our first regularly scheduled Fall Workshop on Tuesday, September 1 and beyond! Workshops are usually scheduled once or twice a month. RSVP!

Be inspired and live your DREAMS! Carpe diem!

Cheers!

Anna Bartos

www.annabartos.com

Founder-Director, STSANY since 2010

Founder-Director, Flor y Canto Chamber Ensemble since 1998

NYU Vocal Faculty from[masked] 

REVIEWS by STSANY members, fellow performers and audience members: 

Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting manyhelpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___. P. Vincent, NYC actor, playwright and STSANY showcase performer.

It was a wonderful session w/a warm, knowledgeable & insightful instructor & in great company!____Allyson, Member, STSANY

Great session; good, helpful feedback; supportive.____Barbara, Member, STSANY

“ Fortunately for me I had the pleasure of Anna helping me with my singing technique which is something that I have always to do. I am looking forward to more meetups and meeting new people. You should all attend this meetup whether you are experienced or a beginner (like me). You will be able to discover something so unique and wonderful about yourself with this group. I can guarantee it! ”______Chels, Members, STSANY

An excellent meetup! Anna knows her stuff and helped me improve my performances; the other members/performers are talented and friendly and fun."____Glen, Member, STSANY

The MUSICALE was a wonderfully diverse program in an intimate setting. I found the preliminary workshops extremely helpful in putting a role I'd worked on (for longer than I'd like to say) into a historical, musical, and linguistic framework. I am eager to do more! Anna Bartos is knowledgeable about a broad range of musical styles and genres, acting and character development as well as singing. I would definitely like to perform in this type of event again. For me, once a season would be good (3-4 times a year)."____Rebecca, Member of STSANY (Musicale on 1/19/14)

Amazing event. Thank you, Anna for holding the musicale. I am also glad to meet new singers.___Saadat, Member of STSANY

What a delightful surprise! One often doesn't know what to expect of a showcase! Congratulations to Anna, a real pro, and an impressive mentor to a diverse array of talent. The 'meet-up' seems to be a real resource for both the performers and those of us in the audience.  Keep up the good work!____Mary Jay, Seasoned Senior Performer

It was a privilege to work with Anna Bartos on this 9/11 memorial concert. All of the performers were of high caliber and the audience rewarded our efforts with heartfelt applause. The program, with its mixture of styles and its emphasis on Americana, was just perfect for the anniversary date. I had a great time yesterday. It was a meaningful and well-organized concert.___ Moshe Knoll, Classical pianist.

Thank you so much for inviting us to perform on this wonderful 9/11 concert.___Rosa Hyewon, Classical Guitarist

results.description:
*You MUST register in order to attend this event!*

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-economics-of-digital-media-tickets-17898872008

How do publishers make their money? Digital advertising is still the industry’s bread and butter; spending continues to grow, and the revenue stream remains hugely important to the media business. But with tech companies and social publishers -- primarily Facebook -- eating up larger portions of the digital ad pie, it’s time for media companies to diversify their revenue models.

We’re bringing together a panel of media professionals who are experimenting with innovative ways to make money for their companies. Subscription models, paywalls, conferences and events, video, crowdfunding, and micropayments are just the start. What works? What doesn’t? Find out at Parse.ly’s final 2015 Summer Series event!

Speakers include:

Joe Purzycki, Head of Partnerships at Medium 

Elise Layton, Director of Revenue Operations at Apartment Therapy

Ryan Brown, VP of Business Development at Gawker Media

Josh Stearns, Director of Journalism and Sustainability at the Geraldine R. Dodge Foundation

And more to be announced!

Food and drinks will be provided. Looking forward to seeing you there!
results.name: THE ECONOMICS OF DIGITAL MEDIA

results.description:
No bar, no beer, no badges, just knowledge sharing, hacking strategies.

Network with a senior IT Recruiter and technology career coach for JP Morgan and your technology colleagues and learn how to effectively identify IT career goals, while enhancing your ability to fine tune your own. Participate in productive networking conversations designed to provide you with the tools necessary to communicate your value and target the best networking resources for you. 

If you are happy in your current role, and interested in moving up within your company, the is the place to understand how to create a road-map for internal mobility designed to improve visibility and recognition levels. If you are unemployed or unhappily employed, this is a forum to understand how to market yourself for future growth without misconceptions about your qualifications and related experience. 

Share hands-on knowledge from the recruiting and career coaching perspective and hear about challenges head hunters face while working with talented IT resources and the obstacles we overcome every day from the hiring side. Learn how to best represent yourself starting with the resume, your elevator pitch, how you respond to questions, what the best questions are for you to ask and some of the most effective methods to follow up. 

When responding with RSVP, we need first, last names for the lobby. Feel free to request my email, if you would prefer using that method instead of this site.


Knowledge is Power. We look forward to sharing! 


Steve

This meetup group was started by the founder of the DaniWeb.com IT Discussion Community who was getting frustrated that all of the meetups she was interested in attending were based in NYC, and it was nearly impossible to get to them on weeknights for people who work out on Long Island.

Join a group of people who work in the tech industry throughout Long Island.

We are a very informal group consisting mostly of web developers and IT consultants, with the occasional application developer thrown into the mix. We talk about the latest projects we're working on and get help and feedback from each other.

The meetup starts at 6 pm but running as late as 10 or 11 pm (sometimes even later!) is the norm. People typically arrive anytime between 6 pm and 9 pm, so don't miss out just because you can't get there by 6. There's usually an early crowd and a late crowd.

results.description:
JOIN US!
Join us at the 6th NJ Music Industry Networking Mixer! Come to socialize with fellow music industry people, musicians, bloggers, producers, label execs, DJs, graphic designers, photographers, and others. Meet. Mingle. Make new friends. Be inspired. Network. We'd like to meet you! 

RSVPs REQUIRED
In order to avoid issues with the venue hosting us, and for them to provide us with adequate meeting space, we need an accurate count of who will be attending. We require all attendees to RSVP for the event. 

PLUS ONES 
Since this is a networking event, if you would like to bring any +1's, please have them RSVP also. Many times people come to the event to specifically meet a certain person or certain people on the RSVP list, so make sure you're on it and your plus one is on it also. 

If your name is not on the RSVP list, you will not be admitted to the event. 

PLEASE NOTE:
This is not a performance event or a jam session so there's no need to bring instruments or gear. There are other Meetup groups that specialize in that kind of thing. This event is an opportunity for exchanging ideas, information, and meeting other music people. 

GIFT BAGS!
We are putting together gift bags for attendees. If you have any promotional items, stickers, download cards, business cards, flyers, etc that you would like to include in these bags so that everyone goes home with your stuff, please contact any of the organizers of this event so we can provide you with information as to how you can do that. 

MUSIC SAMPLERS!
We are also putting together music samplers to include in the gift bags so if you have a song that you would like to include on the sampler, email an organizer and we'll send you the upload link. 

See you there!
results.name: NJ Music Industry Networking Mixer

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

"SUMMER'S OVER BUT WE'RE NOT: so much to talk about..."
presented by CRYPTOPARTY HARLEM

Tuesday August 25th,2015 · 5:45 PM* 
@ Creative Workspace (inside Harlem Business Alliance) 
275 Malcom X Blvd. (aka Lenox Avenue )
NY, NY 10027
* we have a lot to cover so we will start promptly.

@cryptoharlem @cryptopartynyc @cryptoparty


OPEN TO ALL! NO PREVIOUS UNDERSTANDING OR KNOWLEDGE NEEDED & 

THANKS FOR TAKING THE TIME TO READ THIS!

Save the date! Bring your questions & thoughts. This month we will do our best to cover some of the security issues and hacker news of the day. We also will have a special guest (who will talk about their work).

#harlemcryptoparty

# I AM A PRO & WANT TO SPEAK, PRESENT, HELP OUT

security pros interested in helping out? volunteering? contact: 
geminiimatt[at}protonmail.com via secure email &/or otr 
pgp signature: 381A B2F[masked] B00C 467F 0B87 70AA[masked] 
pgp pubkey: </a>http://pgp.mit.edu/pks/lookup?op=get&search=0x0B8770AA07046231 
jabber otr: [masked]

# WHAT'S A CRYPTOPARTY ## ## ## ## 
Cryptoparty Harlem: 

Sorry no chips, dip, awesome music or drinks. Just food for your mind. Ever wonder how to stay private, safe, & secure in today's digital age? What is a cryptoparty anyway? A CryptoParty is free, public and fun. People bring their computers, mobile devices, and a willingness to learn! In the time of the event people will learn and teach how to use basic cryptography tools. <a href="http://cryptoparty.in">Cryptoparties are decentralized global events that are organized to answer questions and instruct people on technology & privacy. Cryptoparties are always free to attend, public, commercially and politically non-aligned and absolutely against sexual harassment and discrimination.

There are no dumb questions, you do not need to know anything about this subject, nor do you even need to bring a computer or phone. However that will help you get the most of it. For more information see the global cryptoparty website:

<a href="https://www.cryptoparty.in/"></a>http://www.cryptoparty.in/

# WHERE ## ## ## ##

Creative Workspace @ HBA 
@CreativeWrkspce 
The #Harlem co-working space located at 
275 Lenox Avenue (also known as Malcom X Blvd) 
NY,NY 
10027

"Power to the Creatives!"

* always free $

closest train 2/3 to 125th Street Station

short wallk from A/B/C/D/ 125th Street Station

ok walk from 4/5/6 125th Street Station

# WHEN ## ## ## ##

Tuesday, August 25th, 2015 @ 5:45pm (-9pm)

# WHY ## ## ## ##

This Summer there has been a large media focus on all these hacks and the capabilities of foreign hackers. Often this media coverage is without the context of the "full story" that most of the hacks were proof of concepts for conference talks at things like blackhat, defcon, USENIX WOOT, etc. 

We will look at these and have a security researcher available to talk about the work they do and their take on the summer and the blackhat conference. Also are co-organizers are coming back from defcon (@huertanix, @tommycollison) , ccc camp (@huertanix, @corcra), & working with black lives matter activist (@geminiimatt)

and of course we will be available to answer, discuss, teach, and learn about secure mobile use, secure browsing (using tor), secure email (using gpg), and secure chat (using otr). 

# BUT WHY HARLEM?! ## ## ##

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EDq-OzMWQwg

 A lot of people don't know that back in December of 2013 NYC lauched The Harlem WiFi network (</a>http://harlemfreewifi.com/) rolled out by Sky-Packets ( <a href="http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/">http://www.sky-packets.com/muni-wifi/ ) it extends 95 city blocks, from 110th to 138th Streets between Frederick Douglass Boulevard and Madison Avenue making it at the time the largest continuous free outdoor public wireless network in the nation. The internet is literally all around us and free in Harlem! So what better place to learn about using it safely.

@geminiimatt has lived in harlem for over a decade and has seen it change for the good & bad. However one thing that has stayed the same is the high level of surveillance & scrutiny faced by residents.  ONLINE: Please read Ben Popper's examination of the fallout from NYPD's Operation Crew Cut ,  "How the NYPD is using social media to put Harlem teens behind bars" (http://www.theverge.com/2014/12/10/7341077/nypd-harlem-crews-social-media-rikers-prison) , ON THE CORNER: Via official nypd cctv surveillance cameras & private owned cameras & FROM UP ABOVE: via SkyWatch tactical platform units and shotspotter (</a>https://www.aclu.org/blog/free-future/shotspotter-ceo-answers-questions-gunshot-detectors-cities), gunshot detection devices.

TWO FACTOR AUTHENTICATION: 
</a>https://twofactorauth.org/
the above link takes you to a list of sites that use 2-step verification.  2-step verification uses your name, password, but then another unknown to piece of info to log in. It can be provided by a hardware token, a texted code or via apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, etc. you can also use the site to help by requesting groups start using 2-step verification.

If you use facebook here is link to the event there (please like our page):

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Cat, Steve and Myself will be available to run.
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

results.description:
How do you count and locate all of the trees in New York City? How do you quantify the process of restoring oysters to New York Harbor’s pre-industrial levels? What does urban microbiology say about the health of a city (other than its disquieting ability to discover unsavory bacteria in the subway)?

A crucial part of any data story is how the numbers are collected, and the motives for doing so. At this edition of data.io, our speakers will describe their approach to enumerating the nature of NYC.

Speakers:

Jacqueline Lu, Director of Analytics for NYC Parks: TreesCount! 2015

Peter Malinowski, Director of the Billion Oyster Project: Restoring Oysters to New York Harbor

Dr. Elizabeth Hénaff, Institute for Computational Biomedicine, Weill Cornell Medical College: Biology and Remediation of Gowanus Canal

Agenda:


6:30p - doors, socializing, food, drinks

7:15p to 8:15p - announcements and talks

9p - event ends

Format:  

3 speakers give 15 minute presentations + 5 minutes for Q&A


Complimentary pizza and beverages.
results.name: A Million Trees, A Billion Oysters, Trillions of Germs: Enumerating Urban Nature

results.description:
There has been some heavy discussions in the Magento community about Magento plugins and whether Magento Connect should continue to accept the ones that are not open sourced. So this month we decided to make this a featured topic.


This months presentations:

Matt Holford
CTO at Do Something (dosomething.org)

"Open Source: Trends with Benefits"

DoSomething.org rebuilt their web platform from the ground up. They also adopted an "open source by default" policy. Matt Holford, CTO, will talk through the rebuild, and the role that open-sourcing played in both technical success and developer happiness.


A little bit about Matt, from his LinkedIn profile:

Sixteen years of leadership in application architecture and development. Specialties include Drupal and other CMS frameworks, Magento, application scalability and performance, and systems architecture.

Clients have included Nike, MTV, PUMA, 1-800-Flowers.com, George Harrison, Sotheby's, Johnson & Johnson, @radical.media, Sony, Uniworld Group, Metallica, and the National Black Programming Consortium.

My recent work has involved architecting and leading the development of high-availability Magento, Drupal, and other LAMP applications that serve millions of page views per day.

Eric Hileman
Co-Founder at MageMojo.com

"Learn the secrets for Magento hosting and how to unlock the full speed of your own store."

- Why Is Hosting Important
- Different Types of Hosting Providers
- Different Types of Hosting Plans
- Hosting Gotcha's
- The Benefits of Hosting Providers Who Specialize In Magento
- Hosting Tips and Tricks For Faster Page Load Times
- Server Side Performance Debugging TipsQuestions

A little bit about Eric:

Hi my name is Eric and I put the mojo in Magento when I cofounded magemojo.com We are a web hosting provider in the US who specializes solely in hosting for Magento and we currently host over 10,000 magento stores. We guarantee faster page load times for Magento than any other host and have a SLA with teeth to back it up. Our customers size range all the way from the small to mid to enterprise. I enjoy answering questions about hosting, Magento performance, and just nerding out about tech in general.

This month's meetup is sponsored by:
Alexander Interactive
http://www.alexanderinteractive.com

Summer IoT Professionals Networking Event


Meet Internet of Things Professionals in the NYC Metro area. We're celebrating a successful year+ (from our first meetup in June 2014) with a Networking Event for Internet of Things Professionals. If you work in the Internet of Things, make connected hardware or the software for them, or have a passion about the Internet of Things, this event is for you!

IoT Central’s mission is to inspire, engage, and connect entrepreneurs, investors, professionals, and enthusiasts worldwide who are active in the Internet of Things (IoT).

Hope to see you there!


Best,

Mitchell

results.description:
Let's climb together at this newly opened indoor rock climbing spot - The Cliffs at LIC - the newest & largest indoor rock climbing gym in NYC area. Mention NYC Active group for receive specials for our meetups (Listed below). 


Specials for our meetup:


• First-time climbers will receive free rental gear. It must be the first visit to the facility and with scheduled meet-up.
• The $99 initiation fee is waived for month-to-month membership for meet-up members if they sign up on a meet-up day.
• Meet-up members will receive 50% off (enter promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD) on the Climbing 101 class on the day of their meet-up. Classes must be booked in advance.

The Cliffs at LIC features:

Expertly-set routes for all levels of climbing experience + ability 
• Over 30,000 square feet of climbing terrain
• Over 125 top rope stations and tons of lead climbing
• 16-foot top-out bouldering
• Professional instructors with a passion for climbing
• Separate Party Room for events + classes
• Full fitness gym
No experience necessary!
Each participant must have a waiver (to be filled out by a parent or guardian for participants under 18)!

Date/Time: Every Tuesday 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm


REGULAR PRICING Posted at Cliffs LIC Website

Day Pass // $28
College Day Pass* // $24
1-Month Pass // $140
Learn to Climb 1-Month Package // $149
10-Visit Pass // $250
Memberships // Click for details

*Full-time college student ages 18-25

RENTALS

Climbing Shoes // $6
Harness // $5
Chalk Bag // $3
Package // $12

Click Here for details on memberships.

CLIMBING 101: TOPROPE BASICS

The facility includes climbing & fitness

Location (Map)

[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101 
(718) 729-ROCK (7625)

Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days
Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square


If you are a total beginner to indoor climbing (never climbed or belayed before), you will need to take a class. Please book "Climbing 101: TopRope Basics" at 6:30 pm on Tuesday by entering promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD or call[masked] & mention NYC Active meetup to get 50% off. This class will teach you how to tie the rope and belay your climbing partner. Gear rental is included in the class. You can still do boulder without taking the class or being belay certified though.


If you are new to The Cliffs at LIC but have been belayed certified in other gym, you can take a test & it will only take few minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please feel free to see me & we can practice together.

More info: http://lic.thecliffsclimbing.com/
results.name: Tuesday Rock Climbing at The Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday 6:30-8:30 all summer long! Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.

Intercambio is free and all skill levels are welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

group.name: El Centro, volunteer led language classes in Midtown

results.description:
Hey Globe Travelers,


We're excited to be on another amazing rooftop yet again. This time, we're at the beautiful Monarch Hotel and we have an open mini bar as well as specially priced cocktails powered by SoftLayer and Hangar 1 Vodka.

Plenty of chances to meet fellow like-minded travelers. Also, if you are interested in being part of a beta group of testers for travel and technology, please let us know, and we'll see to it that you are in.

Chances to win luxe travel gear, Bluetooth speakers, gift certificates and, of course, awesome swag! Madeleine C. Ball will be taking photos all night.

Attendees will receive a special promo code from Hotel Tonight.

Yes we said open mini bar! Hangar 1 Vodka and SoftLayer are powering this incredible event. We look forward to seeing all you inspired travelers there!

Feel free to bring friends again, along with ideas for destinations you'd like to see for the group. It's summer, and we'd love to plan something together. New folks are at every event, so don't worry, we will make introductions! Even without an RSVP, feel free to just show up.

We are always happy to hear your questions, thoughts, or suggestions for current and future mixers. Send them along this way, and we will get back to you stat!

Looking forward to seeing you all, 
Dev, Lauren, Juliette & the rest of the TWIP Crew

TWIP - www.twip.co

TheVane - www.thevane.com

Event hashtag: #TravelTechNYC
results.how_to_find_us: Head to the roof
results.name: A Grand Gathering on the Monarch Hotel Rooftop

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- JJ)

(Co-Leader- Francisco L.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: TUESDAY 6:30pm Soccer @ LIC (2x 7v7 game) for PS2G

results.description:
Experience a Bollywood-inspired dance-fitness program that combines exhilarating choreography and intensive workouts with upbeat music from around the world.

Price: $20/single class or package. Please register for classes on BOLLYX.com.

About the instructor:

Minal Mehta is the Co-Founder and President of BOLLYX. She has a fitness background in competitive synchronized swimming, water polo and swimming, and an artistic background in various styles of dance, including Bollywood, Kathak, jazz, Indian folk, and hip hop. Minal was at the forefront of Bollywood dance exploding in collegiate competitions nationwide, leading her UC Berkeley Bollywood dance team (Aao Na) to sweep all national competitions in 2005. Minal is an AFAA certified group fitness instructor and teaches BOLLYX classes in NYC.  Minal graduated from UC Berkeley in 2005 with a B.A. in Economics with Honors and from Harvard Business School in 2011 with an M.B.A in general management.
results.how_to_find_us: http://bollyx.com/classes/new-york/
results.name: Bollywood Fitness Class at Complete Body

group.name: BOLLYX Bollywood Dance Fitness Classes in New York City

results.description:
>>> Manhattan, Brooklyn et Queens <<<

Pour avoir des bonnes soirées de conversation avec tous les niveaux de la plus belle langue dans le monde entier.  Cette langue de l'aristocratie.  La langue de la France.

Cette Spritzenhaus est un endroit avec des tables à l'extérieur et à l'intérieur (en cas de pluie) qui est très facile à atteindre. Right next to the Nassau Avenue G train stop and the B43, B48 and B62 bus terminal venant de Williamsburg et Long Island City.

Tous les autres dans d'autres endroits (New Jersey, Long Island, etc.) qui peuvent se joindre à nous, sont également les bienvenus.

Il n'y a pas de couvre-feu pour cette rencontre Meetup.  N'importe qui peut venir et rester jusqu'à quand.  Bien que la plupart seront là plus tôt. 

Le coût de cet événement = 1 boisson au minimum.
----------------

(corner of Nassau Ave & Guernsey St)
http://goo.gl/maps/VXh5k

results.description:
Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop

August 25th 2015

Ticket pre-purchase is required to confirm your seat at this hands-on interview techniques, practice and coaching workshop.

Click Here To Buy Tickets

You may have a great resume, but how are your interviewing skills?

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you:

*Are you getting interviews, but not getting any job offers?

*Are you unclear on how to communicate your transferable skills effectively?

*Do you have a hard time preparing/organizing your thoughts before answering interview questions?

*Do “Tell me about yourself” or “Why should we hire you?” cause you anxiety?

Click Here To Buy Tickets

At our Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop, you will:

*Learn fresh, new strategies, methods and techniques to help prepare for a powerful job interview

*Practice your answers in small groups and receive instant coaching/feedback

*Observe a mini mock interview in person

*Discover the top interview questions you must always be ready for

*Get inside the minds of recruiters and the top traits they’re looking for/assessing you on

*Learn how to structure and answer behavioral/scenario-based questions

*Powerfully transform your interview acumen and confidence

Ready to change the entire perspective you’re going to interviews with and position yourself for a job offer?

Complimentary snacks will be served. 

Click Here To Buy Tickets

Purchase your ticket here now to ensure your seat.

Workshop Leader:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at The NYU Stern School of Business.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

Like all our events, this event will sell out ahead of time, and is limited to X participants.

Get full event details and register here:

Click Here To Buy Tickets

Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop

August 25th 2015

Ticket pre-purchase is required to confirm your seat at this hands-on interview techniques, practice and coaching workshop.

Click Here To Buy Tickets

You may have a great resume, but how are your interviewing skills?

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you:

*Are you getting interviews, but not getting any job offers?

*Are you unclear on how to communicate your transferable skills effectively?

*Do you have a hard time preparing/organizing your thoughts before answering interview questions?

*Do “Tell me about yourself” or “Why should we hire you?” cause you anxiety?

Click Here To Buy Tickets

At our Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop, you will:

*Learn fresh, new strategies, methods and techniques to help prepare for a powerful job interview

*Practice your answers in small groups and receive instant coaching/feedback

*Observe a mini mock interview in person

*Discover the top interview questions you must always be ready for

*Get inside the minds of recruiters and the top traits they’re looking for/assessing you on

*Learn how to structure and answer behavioral/scenario-based questions

*Powerfully transform your interview acumen and confidence

Ready to change the entire perspective you’re going to interviews with and position yourself for a job offer?

Complimentary snacks will be served. 

Click Here To Buy Tickets

Purchase your ticket here now to ensure your seat.

Workshop Leader:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at The NYU Stern School of Business.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

results.description:
Meet us on the last Tuesday of the Month to learn, discuss and practice Business Model Generation (BMG), the Canvas, a little bit of Lean Startup and overall business common sense.

This methodology is a simple way to get a high level view of your current or future business and understand how each part of it integrates and interacts with the others. We use the Canvas, a simple diagram, to map these parts and interactions.

While fairly simple, this methodology is a very powerful tool.

You can learn more about the book, methodology, author, and the Canvas :

>> here << 

See you all then !

Dan & Stephen.
results.how_to_find_us: Find us in the Meeting room on the left as you enter.

results.description:
After a terrific #CMMeetup last month, we’re happy to announce the theme for this month’s meetup: Social TV and community!

Join us for a conversation with guests from The Shorty Awards, Found Remote, A&E, and Nielsen Social, as they speak to the future of social TV, show fandom, and that ever present second screen. A big shout-out to Huge for being our lovely host again!

Confirmed Panelists:

- Natan Edelsburg, Senior Vice President at Muck Rack & Shorty Awards, and Executive Editor of Found Remote - @twatan

- Morgan Greco, Sr Director of Sr. Dr. Social Media & Fan Engagement for @AETV, @HISTORY, @More2History - @morgangreco

- Erika Faust, SVP, Client Service, Nielsen Social

-Nisha Chittal, Journalist & Manager, Social Media at @MSNBC - @NishaChittal

Schedule:

6:30PM - 7:00PM - Refreshments / networking

7:00PM - 7:45PM - A conversation with Social TV professionals

7:45PM - 8:15PM - Audience Q&A (Submit your questions with #CMmeetup)

8:15PM - 8:30PM - Job Announcements & Hi-5/App of The Month!

Don't forget to follow us at @cmmeetup and on Facebook!
results.name: #CMMeetup Conversations: Social TV and Community (Meetup in NYC)

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't open our door from 6:30 - 7 pm while meditation is in progress. Kindly refrain from ringing our buzzer during this time.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

results.description:
Tuesdays 6:30pm at La Luz $15 (1st class FREE!)

For more info and schedule, to purchase class pass (also avail in person), visit:

LaLuzNYC.com


Beginners will learn basic capoeira movements ranging from acrobatics and escapes to kicks and other aspects of self-defense.
While building a foundation of basics, you will learn how to put different movements together in combinations and sequences to play the game of capoeira.

Taught by both Luz Emma and her son Adrian Miles!!

Capoeira Muçurumim’s mission is to focus on the healing, martial, and dance aspects of Capoeira Angola and use Capoeira as a forum to bridge cultural gaps, combat community violence, promote self-empowerment, and healing. http://www.capoeiramucurumim.com/

WHAT IS CAPOEIRA ANGOLA:
Capoeira Angola is an Afro-Brazilian martial dance with origins in central and west Africa. It’s roots lie in the N’golo tradition in which two combatants, mimicking the movements of fighting zebras, would compete for the hand of a bride. The better warrior won the bride and was excused from paying a dowry. During the colonial era, this and other martial practices were up-rooted and transplanted to Brazil via the trans-Atlantic slave trade by the Portuguese. In Brazil, the art evolved with influences from different African tribes as well as from the indigenous culture of Brazil, and the effects of European colonialism. In Brazil, Capoeira was used as a means of liberation from societal and psychological constructs of slavery and colonial oppression. Capoeira Angola movements are offensive and defensive, and are primarily made up of kicks, sweeps, and escapes. The Capoeira ceremony takes place in a “roda,” circle in Portuguese, and is accompanied by music and song indicative of African martial arts. From the late 1800’s until the 1930’s, Capoeira, along with other African traditions, was abolished and it’s practitioners persecuted. Today, Capoeira is revered as the cultural treasure of Brazill.

TEACHERS
Luz Emma Cañas M.A., graduated with highest honors from the Chicano Studies Department at the University of California, Santa Barbara. She was a Graduate Fellow in the Department of World Arts and Cultures, U.C.L.A., while attaining her master's degree in Dance Movement Therapy and Rehabilitative Exercise. Extensively trained in classical ballet and modern dance, she has taught Pilates for over thirteen years. She was certified at Golden Bridge, Los Angeles, by the Kundalini Research Institute (KRI) in Kundalini Yoga and Meditation in 2003. She has studied Sufi Mysticism and Healing in the Shadhiliyya Sufi Path under the guidance of Sidi Shaykh Muhammad al-Jamal ar-Rifa’i as-Shadhuli for over ten years and has been researching the healing aspects of Capoeira Angola. Luz has worked with a wide variety of clientele ranging from pre-verbal children to recording artists and super models. She has led workshops on the mind-body interface at Columbia University, Harlem Hospital and for American Airlines. Currently, she is giving continuity to the Capoeira passed down to her through her husband Mestre Jorge (may he rest is peace) through Capoeira Muçurumim and also teaches Kundalini Yoga & Meditation in Brooklyn.

Adrian Miles, began training Capoeira Angola in Los Angeles in 2003. Since then, he has been in contact with reknowned Capoeira Angola masters and their elder students taking workshops, learning directly and indirectly from them. Through Capoeira Muçurumim, Adrian is helping give continuity to the integration of teachings and philosophy of Mestre Moraes and Mestre Jorge by co-teaching classes and workshops for the Department of Education, NYC. Currently, Adrian is a free-lance photographer.

results.description:
What exactly happens when you run 'php example.com'? I wanted to answer this, so I decided to build my own PHP interpreter. Let me tell you what I learned and what fancy words like 'opcodes' and 'bytecode cache' mean. 

With now two main rivals the standard PHP and HHVM from Facebook, there are plenty of choices to run your code fast. But they are both complicated projects, making it hard to understand the inner workings. Rather than relying on them to magically do the right thing, understand the principles of the programming languages you use every day.

===

Juozas, or Joe, as everyone calls him, is an experienced young professional and entrepreneur based in New York City. Started off writing software and has since gravitated towards building technology startups. He has travelled the world talking about technical and business topics. Juozas believes in challenging people to go beyond what they already know. This often results in exciting and unexpected outcomes.
results.name: From PHP to Machine Code - Juozas Kaziukėnas

results.description:
2 teams of 9v9 -a-side. 60min+. Pls arrive early to warm up and be ready to start at 6.30pm


ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and ball.

If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.


• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.


•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.


• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.


• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


The payment goes toward field permit & equipment. 

See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Come out and play some games, hang out, have fun and may be make some new friends.

Leave a comment if you are bringing any games. But it's totally OK if you do not. We'll most likely have enough games for everyone to play. If you are new to games, we'll teach you how to play. New-comers are always welcome.

If your plans change and you can't make it, please update your RSVP.

The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there. Please support them by making purchases of food & drink while we are using their establishment. Do not bring outside food/drink. And don't forget to tip the wait staff. We want to keep a good relationship with them so we can continue to hold our meet ups there.

Come join our board game Facebook group to stay in touch.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

Note: On some occasions the Steinway Billiard Cafe has special events or is simply too crowded to accommodate our group, we would move to the Panera Bread a block away on 35th Ave. When this happen there'll be an announcement in the comment section of this page.
