results.name: Let's do some sparring!

results.description:
Meet us on the last Tuesday of the Month to learn, discuss and practice Business Model Generation (BMG), the Canvas, a little bit of Lean Startup and overall business common sense.

This methodology is a simple way to get a high level view of your current or future business and understand how each part of it integrates and interacts with the others. We use the Canvas, a simple diagram, to map these parts and interactions.

While fairly simple, this methodology is a very powerful tool.

You can learn more about the book, methodology, author, and the Canvas :

>> here << 

See you all then !

Dan & Stephen.
results.how_to_find_us: Find us in the Meeting room on the left as you enter.
results.name: Free : Intro to BMG + Workshop!

results.description:
Join DigitalOcean and Squarespace on Tuesday, August 25th as we dive into Docker and delicious food! 

Speakers include:

Franklin Angulo, Squarespace Engineering Manager

Joonas Bergius, DigitalOcean Engineering Manager

6:30pm - Dinner and drinks

7:00pm - Talks & Live Demos

8:30pm - Q & A

Squarespace on Dockerized Development Environments


Squarespace makes use of many open source projects as dependencies in production to complement the engine that powers millions of customer's websites. We wanted to provide our engineers with a local development environment that closely mirrored the production environment. We found that the whole local environment set up process could be greatly simplified by using automation tools such as Ansible and containerization tools such as Docker. In this talk we will go through the Dockerized development environment architecture, provide demos, and share what we've learned in the process.


DigitalOcean

One of Docker's strenghts is the consistent workflow and improved developer experience once you adopt it in your organization. However, what you might not realize is that once you wish to take your Dockerized application to production, there are a number of additional concerns that you need to start thinking about. This talk will dive in to what those concerns are and share ways in which you might want to think about when shipping Dockerized applications to production.



Please enter at Mercer St, do not add Squarespace to Google maps, this will send you to the wrong address. 


21+ only event. Doors will be closed at 7pm.
results.name: DigitalOcean & Squarespace meetup

venue.address_1: Meet under the Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Arch
venue.name: Grand Army Plaza

results.description:
Hi everyone! Wow - Definitely a positive response to the new meetup group! Thanks! Our first Dash & Dine run will be to Brooklyn Ice House. We will meet under the Soldiers & Sailors Memorial Arch at Grand Army Plaza next Tuesday, 8/25. Run leaves at 6:30PM (per my Verizon phone). Grant and I will be there starting around 6:15PM.

A few things...

1) Please RSVP so we know who will be there. Totally add a photo to your profile if possible, too, so we know what you look like :)

2) Brooklyn Ice House is CASH ONLY so please bring cash and other things you might need like subway card, phone, keys, shoes - ya know, that norm.

3) Run is a little shy of 3 miles to Brooklyn Ice House from the meeting location. You can choose to add more miles before the run around the park or through the neighborhood - I definitely do not encourage doing this afterwards.

4) Getting back logistics: After we dine/eat/nom, however you want to call it, Grant and I will be walking up to the Clark Street station (2,3) which is near the High Street (A,C) and Borough Hall (2,3,4,5) stations. Totally up to you if you want to join us, Uber or find a cab.

5) No runners will be left behind while on the run. If we leave together we end up in the same place together, no matter how slow.

6) Questions? Send a note over! Hope to see you all next week!
results.name: Run to Brooklyn Ice House!

results.name: Movie night- Man from UNCLE

results.description:
A friend of ours likes to say, "CSS rules are so arbitrary, it's like a child wrote the specs." We wouldn't go that far, but coming to web development after working with "real" languages like C++, Python, and Ruby, we had some adjusting to do. Join us as we walk through our struggles as we discuss the top five quirks that have made us want to pull our hair out.

We'll assume a basic knowledge of CSS syntax, selectors, and common properties, but we'll go over the box model in the first few minutes too.

Bonus: We'll also discuss a couple of the most-asked CSS interview questions we've gotten at the end.

KC Soderstrom is a front-end developer at ad analytics start-up Moat. In the past she taught math, worked in forestry and landscaping, and ran three small businesses. She has degrees in applied math and economics from some small school in Missouri.

Zak Stallings is a front end developer at Valtech, a digital agency working with brands such as Rolex and Chanel. After running a furniture store for several years, Zak discovered an intense interest in programming. Wanting to understand the tech field better, he closed up shop and jumped in to tech feet first.
results.name: How to Navigate Quirks in CSS with KC and Zak

Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop

August 25th 2015

Ticket pre-purchase is required to confirm your seat at this hands-on interview techniques, practice and coaching workshop.

Click Here To Buy Tickets

You may have a great resume, but how are your interviewing skills?

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you:

*Are you getting interviews, but not getting any job offers?

*Are you unclear on how to communicate your transferable skills effectively?

*Do you have a hard time preparing/organizing your thoughts before answering interview questions?

*Do “Tell me about yourself” or “Why should we hire you?” cause you anxiety?

Click Here To Buy Tickets

At our Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop, you will:

*Learn fresh, new strategies, methods and techniques to help prepare for a powerful job interview

*Practice your answers in small groups and receive instant coaching/feedback

*Observe a mini mock interview in person

*Discover the top interview questions you must always be ready for

*Get inside the minds of recruiters and the top traits they’re looking for/assessing you on

*Learn how to structure and answer behavioral/scenario-based questions

*Powerfully transform your interview acumen and confidence

Ready to change the entire perspective you’re going to interviews with and position yourself for a job offer?

Complimentary snacks will be served. 

Click Here To Buy Tickets

Purchase your ticket here now to ensure your seat.

Workshop Leader:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at The NYU Stern School of Business.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at The NYU Stern School of Business.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop

August 25th 2015

Ticket pre-purchase is required to confirm your seat at this hands-on interview techniques, practice and coaching workshop.

Click Here To Buy Tickets

You may have a great resume, but how are your interviewing skills?

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you:

*Are you getting interviews, but not getting any job offers?

*Are you unclear on how to communicate your transferable skills effectively?

*Do you have a hard time preparing/organizing your thoughts before answering interview questions?

*Do “Tell me about yourself” or “Why should we hire you?” cause you anxiety?

Click Here To Buy Tickets

At our Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop, you will:

*Learn fresh, new strategies, methods and techniques to help prepare for a powerful job interview

*Practice your answers in small groups and receive instant coaching/feedback

*Observe a mini mock interview in person

*Discover the top interview questions you must always be ready for

*Get inside the minds of recruiters and the top traits they’re looking for/assessing you on

*Learn how to structure and answer behavioral/scenario-based questions

*Powerfully transform your interview acumen and confidence

Ready to change the entire perspective you’re going to interviews with and position yourself for a job offer?

Complimentary snacks will be served.

results.description:
Do you want to learn techniques to give your cards that extra WOW? 

Do you have a huge shelf of embossing powders (yep, that's mine in the picture) and want to learn new ways to use them? 

Are you new to card making and want to try something new? 

This event is for card makers of all experience levels! Tonight, I will walk you step-by-step through techniques for heat embossing your cards. We will make 4 cards tonight that are perfect to give away to your loved ones and have that personalized, handmade touch. ALL SUPPLIES ARE INCLUDED-just come tonight ready to learn and have a great time. 

You will also leave tonight with a brand new container of WHITE EMBOSSING POWDER from Stampin' Up! to start or add to your collection. 

Buunni Coffee will stay open from 6:30-7:00 so that you can purchase coffee, tea and snacks. It is important that our group supports Buunni at the beginning of the event if you are able. The store closes at 7:00pm but we will continue crafting there after hours. We will start at 6:30 so please be on time and message Heidi with any transportation issues. (It is helpful to download the Meetup App to your cell phone. This is a quick way to receive all notifications of events and to message Heidi directly through the app.)

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Mansions of the Soul by H. Spencer Lewis

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 2: Why Are We Here?

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

The definitive work on reincarnation and the soul, this Rosicrucian classic explains all about the soul and its cycles of reincarnation. The ideas expressed here will remove from your consciousness any fear of so-called death.

Reincarnation is one of the world's most disputed doctrine. The belief in reincarnation has had millions of intelligent, learned, and tolerant followers throughout the ages. Ringing through the minds and hearts of students, mystics, and thinkers have always been the words: "Why Are We Here?" Reincarnation has been criticized by some as conflicting with sacred literature and as being without verification. This book reveals, however, in an intelligent manner the many facts to support reincarnation.

Quotations from eminent authorities, and from Biblical and Sacred works substantiate reincarnation. It places it high above mere speculation. This book is without exaggeration the most complete, inspiring, enlightening book ever written on this subject. It is not a fiction story but a step-by-step revelation of profound mystical laws. Look at some of these thought-provoking, intriguing subjects: The Cosmic Conception; The Personality of the Soul; Does Personality Survive Transition?; Heredity and Inheritance; Karma and Personal Evolution; Religious and Biblical Viewpoints; Christian References; Between Incarnations; Souls of Animals and the "Unborn"; Recollections of the Past.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Mansions of the Soul: Why Are We Here?

results.description:
Become the best damn hypnotist you can – Tuesday night* Practice Group

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues August 25th for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Each meeting will focus on something new or in need of practice so we can improve our skills and expand our range. We’ll watch videos of Milton Erickson in action and take the time to dissect them and really learn from them. You’ll learn and share new techniques. We’ll swap scripts. We’ll swap books and other media. Above all, we’ll PRACTICE and get GOOD.

One benefit you get from attending is the group support of learning. Last time we met we watched a couple of hours of a newly available DVD set called “In the Room with Milton Erickson.” It’s how Erickson taught Ericksonian Hypnosis. Up to maybe a dozen people would squeeze into his office and listen to him speak and watch him do demos. Now YOU can be in that room too. It’s pretty amazing, really, and SO instructive. I love it.

AND – it’s only $20 a night! (Amazing deal.)

Open to graduates of Doug’s NLP or Hypnosis trainings or students who have received similar training from other reputable training centers.

TUESDAY evening, August 25th

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY so we can start at 7:00


CLICK HERE - ONLY $20 (via PayPal)

Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
</a><a href="http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com/">http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
– Jackie

"Best Meet-up ever.”
– Kate

“Your Trance Night was a wonderful respite from the world. It was like a vacation from all of the stresses of every day life, a vacation for my soul. It continues to ripple though me today. So glad I came.”

– Marshall

Ananda Mandala is a Chakra clearing meditation designed to raise Kundalini energy. This guided meditation involves vigorous (Pranayama) breathing techniques.

Diksha  is an energy transfer that works by activating Kundalini energy. This creates a gradual shift in consciousness, freeing you from the suffering created by the mind, balancing the body's natural healing energies and attuning the brain to higher levels of awareness. Diksha does not belong to any religion or belief. It is a universal energy that can be received by anyone.

ANANDA MANDALA to be followed by DIKSHA.

*Please arrive promptly at 6:45pm so as not to inconvenience other participants. If you arrive after the first process has started you will have to wait until it is completed to join.

$10 suggested

results.description:
Description: Join Salsa NewYork  for a fun Salsa on2 Beginner and Intermediate Lesson every Tuesdays at 6.45pm at Hayaty !

DJ Mustachio Spinning the Best Salsa Music on Planet Earth. 

LIVE Music by Tres Del Solar

Hookahs Available!!!

$7 Mojitos,$6 Sangrias,$5 Coronas


• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , you must RSVP for this meetup before 4 pm on the day of the event

• Instructors: 

Franck Muhel/ Born in Martinique, Franck’s performances are renowned for their dynamic creative energy that inspires and electrifies audiences all over the world. As principal dancer with Eddie Torres, the Mambo King, and featured soloist, Franck has performed with internationally accl

aimed orchestras: Eddie Torres Mambo Kings Orchestra, Frankie Morales Orchestra, Jimmy Delgado Orchestra, Jimmy Bosch Orchestra, Orlando Marin Orchestra, Roberto Rodriguez Band, Eddie Montalvo Band, Frankie Vasquez & Los Soneros Del Barrio, Bobby Sanabria and more... www.Franckmuhel.com

Sophie Cazeneuve/ Native of France, She competed successfully in France and Europe in International Latin and Standard . In France, Sophie discovered West Coast Swing, which she became madly passionate about. She won the French Open WCS Showcase in 2010 and placed in a few Jack and Jill. She also competed in salsa on 2 ( 8th place at the World Sa

lsa Cup in Las Vegas, 2011).

Afterwards, she decided to move to New York to further pursue her passion of dancing. She is now teaching Latin dances, west coast swing, salsa and wedding dances in New York. Sophie is currently competing professionally in American Rhythm and Smooth.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A-X1L-flvzc

• Price: $10 for 1 lesson or $15 for 2 lessons/  free admission to the party

• Time: Beginner lesson 6.45 pm, Intermediate lesson 7.45 pm  Party until 1 am

• Address: Hayaty 103 Avenue A, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
